Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mimmica
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is everything you may want for you stay in Rome - nice, clean, cozy and close to everything! Great breakfast, kind and helpful people, a true Roman experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Condotti”
Reviews.Author: Annette Leif H
Reviews.Content: A small wonderful hotel in the center of Rome, close to the Spanish Steps. The rooms are on the small size but spotles and the starff are very helpfull. It is the 2. time we are here,and we hope to come back again soon! Annette, Ruth and Orla. Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Magnifico!!”
Reviews.Author: RV P
Reviews.Content: Very nice location. Situated in a well lighted street. We were walking around in the area past midnight and we felt safe. Very warm and accommodating hotel staff. Kudos to Paula, Daniella, Alex...Pleased with the buffet breakfast. Fantastic restaurants just 5 minutes away (we tried Mario, Live and 34). There was even a Japanese restaurant 10 minutes away. There were 2 delis 5 minutes away and a Carrefour Express 10 minutes away. The hotel even had an aperitif hour ( champagne, red and white wine on the house)...My only negative comment was about the toiletries. The quality of the bath gel and shampoo could be greatly improved. By the way, we stayed a total of 8 nights. We were a group of 7 including a young boy and his grandma.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LeticiaGarcia
Reviews.Content: A great hotel with a great location. The staff were really helpful and friendly. The price is fair. I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “What a lucky find!”
Reviews.Author: gas700girl
Reviews.Content: Staying in this hotel was part of a 21st birthday surprise holiday for my daughter who had always wanted to go to Rome so I wanted somewhere really nice, not too expensive but with a good central location. Based on the reviews, I opted for this hotel and it turned out to be the perfect choice! It's located in a lovely little cobbled street just a few yards from the Spanish Steps, Via da Condotti (designer street) and Metro station. Upon arrival the staff couldn't have been more helpful. There was six in our party so we had two doubles and one twin room all located in the main hotel building. One of the doubles was a little small but still very nice. The decor was excellent and the room was perfectly clean. The view from our windows was just the back of other buildings but that was the area it was in and you couldn't expect anything else unless you had one of the very few rooms that overlooked the cobbled street in front. The hotel has a lovely reception area with luxurious chairs to sit and read papers or tourist material they had in a folder. There was also a computer with internet on that you were free to use. Every 2nd evening they would have a table,in reception, with refreshments for you as you were on your way out or on your way in to the hotel. There was champagne style white wine, red wine, orange juice and various nibbles, all served by a member of staff. It made a very relaxing start to your night to have a few glasses of wine and a lovely chat to staff that were always interested to know what you had done that day and where you were off to that night. If I had any critisim at all it would be breakfast. This was served between 7.30am - 10.15am and was of a continental sytle.You had a choice of meats, cheese, salad, cold chopped omelete, croisants, pastries, cereal, tinned fruit, yoghurt, fruit juices and tea/coffee. This sounds great but the hot water for tea was from a flask so obviously not hot enough to make tea with and the food didn't seem to get refilled throughout the breakfast time, once it was gone, it was gone. It also wasn't all ready out for 7.30. So we found that if you wanted a full choice of everything, the best time to go down to breakfast was between 8am - 9am. There was only one member of staffon breakfast duty who wasn't very friendly. A special mention for the cleaning staff who were lovely and friendly and did a supberb job. Also when I had my purse stolen in Rome the staff immediately gave me their phone to phone my bank back in the UK and didn't charge it to our room and let us use it as long as we needed. Even with the slight critisim of breakfast I still give this hotel 5 stars and would highly recommended it to anyone for any occasion. We fully intend to go back to Rome and to this hotel. I've already recommended it to several friends.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive hotel for the quality, room, and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: twoods13
Reviews.Content: I expected the rooms to be small however linens were not great quality, room was clean, breakfast is terrible quality for the price 10 euros equal to a Days INN- I am meaning can fruit contail, back of hotel overlooks back yards, kitchens of restaurants, and kids toys in the yard, and car service to airport when leaving was a joke, our driver appeared to have slept in his suit with stains on his clothes, seat of car, cost was 60 euros; however,hotel location is perfect! I would never stay here again when other hotels in the area are better! At last, one can rent a room in Traverse City MI 4 star for half the cost is it is beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Be hard to get better”
Reviews.Author: jobfamily
Reviews.Content: Right from the start this hotel ticked all the boxes. Location, fab, right next to the Spanish steps, metro, cafe's, and restraunts. All attractions walkable. Staff very friendly, attentive and helpful. Rooms clean, airey, refurbished and addequately stocked and cleaned. For the price we paid I do not think another hotel can rival it. i would recommend to my friends and grandmother! Cannot wait to return, well done Condotti!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: madmortons
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of friends, ideal location in the centre of Rome. Staff at reception were very helpful, both before and during our stay. The rooms were small, but nicely decorated and very clean, our room was cleaned daily to a very good standard. the breakfast was more than adequate with a good selection of fruit, pastries, bread , cold meats, salad, yoghurts and fresh coffee.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best locations in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Lyck41
Reviews.Content: Location, location and location again. Close to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain etc. and last but not least - Via Condotti with all the nice shops, watch your credit card! It can quickly become an expensive acquaintance. The hotel is a small cozy boutique hotel with small but nice rooms and pleasant staff. Are you interested in fast cars, have a talk with the owner Rudy who has spent most of his life in everything that can run fast - from go-cart to Formula 1. We were there for a week in the dawning spring and it is not the last time we visit the Hotel Condotti. Lyck CPH

Reviews.Title: “Small, cozy and diamond sparkling clean”
Reviews.Author: KassandraCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a pleasant surprise! Our room wasn't exactly big but included a big terrace with a breathtaking view over the rooftops of Rome. All members of the staff were very kind and supplied the family feeling that makes smaller hotels nicer to stay in. They all spoke english well. Cleaning was immaculate - they even sprinkled soap over the carpets before vacuum cleaning them! Breakfast is not what interest italians the most. The hotel buffet was good for italian standards with freshly made cappucinos and wholegrain croissants. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Louise P
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying here for 3 nights, I have to say, I really enjoyed my stay here! My husband and I were in a separate building just round the corner, although the room was quite small, there was a lovely separate bathroom and enough room to store our luggage with no problems. It was very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The location is fantastic, the spanish steps are just round the corner, as well as the main open top tour bus routes, and all the major brand shops like Gucci and Dior! It is surrounded by many lovely restaurants that are reasonably priced so lots of choice as to where to eat out! Thoroughly enjoyed my stay here with no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: pnina m
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just come from a week in Rome. We stayed in the Condotti hotel and enjoyed it very much, especially the friendly crew that was able to help whatever we asked. Location is wonderful. The bathroom was very large and comfortable. I just recommand to exchange the blankets to modern ones, or at list to put them into a pulp. In the bottom line: we enjoyed very much.

Reviews.Title: “VERY small double rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: phillinda
Reviews.Content: I booked a standard double room and it was the smallest room I've ever stayed in. Small even by European standards. Fit a double bet with a half arms length to walls on both sides. Bathroom was tiny and shower so small you bump into the sides everytime you move. Bathroom has been upgraded but bed linens are showing wear. Holes in the wallpaper covered by spackling. No place to put your suitcase. Good things were a safe and a TV. Bed uncomfortable. Room needs upgrading. Best thing about hotel is the great location. Right near the Spanish Steps and a short walk to Piazza del Popolo. 15 - 20 minute walk to the Colosseo and Roman Forum. Lots of shops and restaurants in the immediate vincinty of the hotel. Also, rooms are quiet with windows shut. For the money, I would look around. I think there were be better choices in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: Criky4
Reviews.Content: I read with interest the bad reviews of this hotel because our stay was lovely. The day man on the front desk was the most helpful person we found in all Italy. Yes the rooms are small but the location is wonderful and the breakfasts and staff in the dining room were great. Would recommend highly!

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bastis
Reviews.Content: Charming little hotel in a great location. Very close to the Spanish steps. Very nice staff, great service. If you are looking for a no frills little hotel, you have come to the right place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Ornad7
Reviews.Content: Was very happy with this hotel, the location was perfect, at the bottom of the Spanish steps and right next to a metro stop, the room was kept very clean throughout our stay. It was a small room but did the job for us. We were in the annex which is even better located than the hotel itself, directly under the Spanish steps. Breakfast was not included in our package and was €10 if we wanted one which I thought was a bit expensive. Would definitely recommend to a friend, overall our stay with Hotel Condotti was very enjoyable, with pleasant, helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Mane
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from our trip to Rome where we stayed at the Hotel Condotti for 2 nights. I can honestly say that this is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. It was great value for money; the rooms were lovely and very comfortable and the location was perfect! Only a 2 minute walk from the Spanish Steps and Spagna metro station. The staff in the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful, helping us to print off our boarding passes, etc. for our return home. We didn't have any problems at the hotel but, from the attitude of the staff, I'm sure that if we had they would have been sorted out immediately. Thank you to everyone at the Hotel Condotti for a truly brilliant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good location & great customer service”
Reviews.Author: KarenCheong
Reviews.Content: We were recommended by a fren to stay at Condotti and we r not disappointed. Great location, short walk to Spanish steps and other surrounding attractions are too far away. We were on an early morning flight and have to leave for airport at 4.30am and would miss breakfast which was included in the room rate. We requested if some food can be arranged to be sent to our room in the night. It's not the usual practice and we are glad the hotel made an exception! We found some croissants and drinks in a meal tray when we got back from dinner. Nice touch of meeting customers' needs. Thanks to Romolo!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Rome close to Spanish stairs.”
Reviews.Author: IpekB
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in the first week of Feb 2012 when it snowed in Rome first time since 25 years.. Hotel Condotti was excellent by meeting my cozy stay requirements in Rome. It is not luxury but it offers a cozy, basic, clean and warm stay. I have chosen a superior double room (although would stay single) to make sure the room is spacious and it was reasonable indeed. One thing that can be improved is that the bed mattress was too hard. They need a change to a more comfortable model. Hotel location is fantastic as it is just 100m away from the Spanish stairs. The front desk ladies and man in duty at night were very welcoming and helpful. Thanks again to the very nice house keeping lady! I would defintely stay again.. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: 4peopleonthego
Reviews.Content: I have been to the hotel condotti twice now, and whilst pleasant and well situated I am concerned about the throwing around of a 4 star status. In reality it is a strong 3 star hotel that seems to be nowadays overpriced. For the cost displayed on the website, it may be worthwhile to investigate other hotels in the vicinity that may offer larger rooms. Nevertheless, the Condotti is a small, safe haven with pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are basic but location is excellent”
Reviews.Author: xkatie84x
Reviews.Content: Stayed here March 2011 for 2 nights. Rooms are clean and basic, walls are thin but for me, the hotel is just somewhere to sleep at night. Brilliant location and reasonably priced breakfast is also more than adequate. Would definately return purely down to location. Right near spanish steps and walking distance to trevi fountain. Hop on/hop off bus tour stop is only a 5 min walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: cja7274
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Condotti for 3 nights, it was our second time there! The hotel is clean, the staff are extreemly helpful and the location is just great - just a couple of minutes from all prime spots!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for upmarket shopping area in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sofia338_71
Reviews.Content: A very quaint hotel situated "next door" to Via Condotti, the evergreen upmarket shopping area. Not at all far away is the Spanish Steps with all its glory. Just a short walk away from the Trevi Fountain for me to throw the coin for good luck! Excellent, excellent location! The hotel has an atmosphere of vintage ambience with quality service from the reception and other services, including that of the bell boy. This is our second stay in Hotel Condotti (enjoyed the private terrace even though it was a bit chilly in January...). Perhaps the breakfast selection should include an egg dish. Notwithstanding, we will certainly be back for our next trip in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Swiss_voyagerII
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. We had planned to stay longer but the room was too small to be comfortable for a prolonged stay and there was renovation work on the floor above which disturbed us in the mornings. Pros: Fantastic location - walking distance of key sights and some great shops and restaurants; Friendly, helpful staff; Clean rooms (though note the bathroom issues below); Reasonable breakfast with great coffee. Cons: The standard double room we had was very small; the bathroom (also a tight squeeze) had an electric fan heater but you can't keep that on all the time and in between it was very cold - the bathroom floor was constantly glacial; on 2 of our 3 nights the bathroom smelt like the sewers (the odours apparently coming up through the drainage system during the night); you often end up climbing the steep staircase (and climbing over the dirty linen which is piled in the hallways) as the lift is hard to get access to (not helped the night staff were cleaning it before 10pm); get to breakfast early or risk a crowd in the small dining room! Our stay was not made easier by renovation work on the floor above which started about 7.30am each day, with power tools kicking in one day soon after 8.30am. Lie-ins were impossible. All hotels need maintenance - but surely not in the peak Christmas holiday period!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Christmans”
Reviews.Author: nika857
Reviews.Content: It was the first time that i was in Rome, and Hotel Condotti it was a good choice. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. I didn't liked the room, thay change it without problem to make me happy. The hotel was in the center of the Rome, near Piazza di Spagna, Trevi fontain, shopping ect. Everything is great. The only problem is to have breakfast out of hotel, is beter to pay hotel with breakfast included. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “cozy central hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichelaMaud
Reviews.Content: Staff is extremely friendly and helpful - I would rate them 5 star. Hotel is definitely 3 star. Very cozy clean rooms. If you want to combine shopping with sightseeing, this hotel is well located. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Roman stay”
Reviews.Author: Loh999
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at this 3 starred property. Was impressed by its location. Rooms was good and clean. Hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Alice_Dinkins
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in November with friends before our cruise. The location was great. Perfect for walking to many of the must see sites of Rome and many great places to eat. The rooms were very clean, the breakfast had a nice assortment and the staff couldn't have been nicer. We were lucky enough to get room 310 with the balcony acoss the front of the hotel. It was fun to sit out there and enjoy a break. The rooms have flat screen TV's, in room safes and mini bars. As a bonus the staff served refreshments before dinner time where we had a chance to meet other travelers staying there. We would definitely recommend this to friends and would love to stay here again. Jaalice

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: Lace H
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my honeymoon after reading all the great reviews. For a while I would write the hotel emails trying to book transportation from the airport to the hotel since I never been to Rome and I had no idea how easy or difficult it was to get a taxi to the hotel. They were VERY helpful even before I arrived because they scheduled the transportation for us and the driver was super nice! When we arrived everyone spoke English and was very, very helpful and friendly. The rooms were small, but that's expected in Europe. When you go to Italy you only need the hotel room to sleep anyway! The room was clean and the hotel was very close to all the main attractions. Breakfast was included and very yummy, crossiants, eggs, meats, juice, pastries, cappuccino, bread, jelly, etc. Free wifi in the hotel made it easy to keep in touch to people back home through emails and facebook! Would definately stay here again! Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Everything”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_From_LA
Reviews.Content: A group of 6 of us had 4 rooms for one night the beginning of November. We originally booked the "Annex" and imagine are surprise when 3 of the rooms were ready at 9 AM and we had been upgraded to the main hotel. The hotel is perfectly located one block from the Spanish Steps. The room came with Wifi, breakfast which was fantastic, and one of the couples had a large balcony. The hotel even hosted a wine reception in the evening. The room, small by American standards, but average by European standards was very clean, seemed to be recently renovated, and had everything you'd need in it. I had a problem with the hot water and they literally sent someone up to fix it immediately! I can't ask for anything more than that. Vladamir, Danielle, and the Canadian Receptionist (naturally) all spoke impeccable English and were helpful throughout the stay. One of our group ended up with an Annex Room and it's literally 30 feet from the main hotel. You get a separate key to the building. There is a large flight of stairs (drawback) but the rooms are of the same renovated standard as the main hotel. Again, I wouldn't hesitate recommending this hotel and if I were to go back to Rome again, I'd definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Well run, great location”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean, well run hotel in a great location. Our room was small (310) but it had a great balcony. But when in Rome why do you want to be in your room. The breakfast was good and the staff are all polite and friendly. Would recommend this hotel to family or friends. Also has free WiFi access which is a bonus..

Reviews.Title: “Great Service & Location”
Reviews.Author: SteveJB
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 3 nights at the Condotti Hotel in the annex. Best thing about this hotel is the location, a 1 minute walk to the Spanish Steps and the service was first class. The room we had in the annex was tired and needed a refurb. Bed was very hard but the room had all the usual facilities. Just remember it is a 3 star hotel. Staff were excellent, nothing was too much trouble, very helpfully everyone spoke english. Would recommend it for a short city break, good value for its level - don't expect 5 star accommodation for 3 star prices. We had breakfast included, breakfast room was small with a limited range on the buffet on offer - biggest issue for me no fresh milk. Overall enjoyed the stay and would recommend this hotel. With a great restaurant right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Day in Rome”
Reviews.Author: marble2
Reviews.Content: Six of us spent the night here on our way to a cruise. Excellent value, wonderful location and very pleasant, helpful staff. Will stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “The best location in Rome for $270 per night”
Reviews.Author: Rick F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Rome in early June, 2011 and I am happy to say we chose the right hotel. The Condotti Hotel has the best location of any hotel under $350 per night based upon my research and experience. Its only 2 blocks from the Spanish Steps, and within walking distance of all major attractions. Equally as important , its located in a neighborhood of narrow, quiant streets filled with small outdoor cafes and occasional travelling accordian players. Yet with all these nearby sights and sounds, it is relatively quiet at night because it is far from the busy roadways and crowded piazzas. My only complaint was that our room was small. However, fortunately, the balconies overlooking the street did permit a means of escape.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Ian S
Reviews.Content: From the time we were picked up by the Limo at the airport until we left in a thunderstorm, we had a great time. We stayed in the annex, the room was fine except the person who lived in the apartment next door most have worked late as the TV or radio was very loud in the early hours of the morning. The staff were very helpful but couldn't do anything about that. The breakfast is exactly as it says, "continental" although they did triy to vary it a bit. The best part of all, is it's location, you can walk to all the places you want to go. My wife loved the shops in Via Condotti our credit caed not so much. Our neighbour in Australia suggested this Hotel Thank you! Would we go back this Hotel? Absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: Steven S
Reviews.Content: Terrific location, friendly and accommodating staff and delightful rooms make this one of my top picks for Rome. Just a block from the Spanish Steps, it's walking distance to just about everywhere and a short metro ride to everywhere else. The hotel itself is on a lovely side street and is surrounded by nice cafes, restaurants and shops. Great attention to detail (like fluffy and plentiful towels in the bathrooms) helps create a positive impression.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Condotti - Welcomes You With Open Arms”
Reviews.Author: ciarancarr
Reviews.Content: The location of Hotel Condotti is perfect with the Spanish steps, pantheon and Trevi fountain all within easy walking distance. Vladimir is a most welcoming manager who is eager to ensure you have a good stay (including a wine tasting night now and again). I stayed in a room in the seperate building which thou needed a bit of updating was more then adequate for my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: JennieB55
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here only for 1 night and were wishing we had many more. The location was perfect - walked here from the station (Spagna) and found the hotel easily. The reception staff were very friendly, welcoming and helpful especially with what to do in 24 hrs. The room though on small side was clean & comfortable & surrounded by good cafes, restaurants, shops and of course walking distance to so many attractions. We were recommended to stay here by some Aussie friends who were here earlier in the year, and would highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,comfortable great location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: tegadm
Reviews.Content: With its location close to plaza Spagna and near Plaza Popolo,this hotel is in a great spot. We never had to walk far for an excellent dinner, and taxis were right around the corner. The staff was helpful an friendly.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: jermu S
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Room (in the separate building because of triple room) was larger than we tought and the staff was very friendfull! Hotel's location was perfect. It was easy to go any part of the center of Rome from there! Hotel was also little cheaper than others as close to the center. Breakfast was ok, but it was much better than we tought, as many travel guides told that hotel breakfasts are very bad and expensive. If you pick this hotel, you should go to eat at Il Brillo Parlante at via della fontanella 12! It is close to the hotel and you can get excellent pizzas from there!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: epinItaly
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good location. The room in the separate building is clean, but we had requested a triple and did not set it up with 3 separate beds, when I asked for them to do so they said they would do it and never did. We also had friends who were supposed to stay with us and made confirmed reservations and when they arrived they were told that they did not have a room for them. Maybe the actual hotel was nice, but the separate building is cheaper for a reason.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tara14_11
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, really enjoyed our stay here. Very clean, room wasn't that big but this is normal for European cities. Bathroom was actually much bigger than I expected. We even had a balcony overlooking the streets below. Very friendly and helpful staff. Would definitely stay here again! Location was brilliant, right beside spanish steps and within walking distance of everything. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: db7154
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Condotti! It's in a great location - easy to walk just about anywhere and close to the subway. Cute rooms with nice bathrooms. Front desk staff (especially Vladimir) were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was nice. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa C
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Condotti on many occasions and every time has been a memorable experience. The location is perfect and buzzing with atmosphere. The hotel is never dull and the rooms are perfect and reasonably priced for such a prestigious area. We shall keep returning as it seems like a home from home. Vanessa C

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MTtravelers2011
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Condotti. The staff were pleasant, cheerful and very helpful. It's very convenient location for sites, metro, shopping. The room was of adequate size, though the lighting was not great and I could have used more counter space in the bathroom. Providing breakfast before we started out on our day was also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Involuntarily moved to lesser hotel”
Reviews.Author: TeresaB25
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here prior to a Country Walkers trip but on our planned stay after our CW trip, we were told our room was unavailable due to "lack of water" on one floor. We were moved to a nasty hotel but stuck for the same price we had reserved at Hotel Condotti. The whole event seemed odd. If it was truly a forced move due to a water issue, the least they could do is secure an equivalent lodging for the money we paid. Our initial stay was lovely, but the return left us cold.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sojourner414
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location--shopping, metro, sights. We walked or rode the metro to everywhere we needed to go. The staff was extremely helpful and engaging. Our room was not big but was certainly adequate (who goes to Rome to stay in their room?) with a nice bath. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall rating 3.5”
Reviews.Author: trvlquestions
Reviews.Content: The location is great. The only time we took transportation was for arrival and departure; otherwise, we walked everywhere. We were in Rome for 3 nights and had booked a standard room in the annex. In the photos other travelers had posted on Trip Advisor, these rooms looked more spacious and had good light . We were given a room in the building on Via delle Carrozze, and it was awful. The walls, baseboards, & door frames are in great need of repair; the only window is a small one on a door looking out to a stairwell & another building. The room felt dirty, and there was a spider in the bed. The only good thing was the bathroom. I immediately went back to the lobby and asked to be changed. Unfortunately, they were not able to change us that night but said they could for the remaining 2 nights. It was hard to believe that both buildings are part of the same hotel. The annex on Via della Croce is clean & updated; you notice the difference the minute you walk in the building. The only negatives to this annex are: 1) We were on the street side, and it's on a noisy, lively street (cafes below). They have good windows that block out most of the noise, and it was fun to look down on the action below. 2) a new shower head is desperately needed. The front desk staff was nice, and it was very helpful to have the computer in the lobby. We did not have their breakfast, as we prefer to find a local place for coffee & breakfast pastries. It's usually a much better breakfast, you get to mingle with the locals on their way to work, and it costs much less. We went to a good place on Via della Croce - corner of Via Bocca di Leone or Via Belsiana, same side of Via della Croce as the annex. In terms of an overall ranking, the first room was a 1, and the second room was a 3+ (would have been a 4 if the shower was better).

Reviews.Title: “Close to major sites”
Reviews.Author: netter75
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent for walking to many of the major sites of Rome. It is located very close to some excellent cafes and restaurants. The hotel itself is somewhat dated but otherwise clean and has helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “pleasure”
Reviews.Author: DublinBreda
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel in an excellent location , close to the historical sights, an abundance of restaurants, wine bars etc. Staff could not be more helpful - if one wishes to be met at the airport on arrival contact the hotel beforehand and they will provide a taxi service - this takes all the hassle out of arriving at a busy airport trying to decide how to get to your destination. We opted for a superior room and were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive 2 day stay-Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Steve R
Reviews.Content: Great location but at Euro 200 per night for the smallest room ever, a major disappointment. Internet worked off and on, BBC on channel 11 in guide never worked and after two weeks of no news we thought paying Euro 200 a night would guarantee news in English. Hotel did not care and offered no real appology and certainly no credit even when asked. Breakfast had cold meats and cheeses, etc. coffee was confusing with not ID of strong vs Americana so in an effort to not waste we drank some mind blowingly strong Italian coffee which tasted burnt. All in all not a very good value and in regard to the credit for lack of BBC news the Italian lust for a few extra dollars came out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JessicaStaceyClare
Reviews.Content: My stay here at this hotel was from 8/24/11-8/27/11. The staff was extremely friendly and the rooms were very clean with a great view of the Rome streets. The staff spoke excellent English which was a big help. The location of the hotel is in a perfect location for walking to the Spanish Steps, the Trevi fountain, and many piazzas.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Condotti Rome”
Reviews.Author: pengachoosa
Reviews.Content: From our first entrance into the Hotel we were sold. The staff was friendly and helpful and the rooms were nice. The location was very good just a block and a half from the Termini station and just as close to the Spanish steps. The breakfast was good free wi-fi, very reasonably priced and air conditioning. I would stay here again next time I visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “It won't be our last visit”
Reviews.Author: michael s
Reviews.Content: The staff was freindly and competent, the roomn spacious and clean, our services rendered flawlessly. Our second stay will not be our last as we threw coins in the Trevi Fountain guaranteeing our return to Roma...and it will be at the Hotel Condotti as it shoud be!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best value in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Alfredo I
Reviews.Content: Excelent location (two minute walk to the stairs in Piazza de Spagna, two minute walk to the high class shops in Via Condotti), very friendly staff, large and comfortable room with a balcony, good breakfast, nice decoration both in the room and the reception, AC, cable TV and wi-fi in the room, for 95 euros a night (double room) during the high season, is indeed a rare find in Rome these days.

Reviews.Title: “Returned to stay here in Rome, was here four years ago”
Reviews.Author: torp16
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to Italy. Four years ago our travel agent suggested this hotel. It is nice, friendly, good service and in a great location in Spagna. We had to exit guest room hallway to street and go a few feet around the corner to the lobby desk but that was absolutely NO inconvenience and no deterrence to our decision to return here. The hotel is two blocks from Spanish steps, metro stop Spagna, but even more importantly, many shops of all price ranges and fine trattorias and restauraunts. Would definitely stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for Europe”
Reviews.Author: Juliana891
Reviews.Content: As long as you don't go in with the expectation that this will be a grand resort like the ones we find in the US you will be fine. It was clean, the staff was friendly and the breakfast was adequate. The location is what really makes it worth it. Our room was very nice and had a large balcony. Sure, the furniture and decor is outdated but as long as the bed is clean what else can you ask for whn you are paying a more affordable rate?

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Eurotravelmom
Reviews.Content: Superb service (got directions to the beach, which subway stops and why, how much for umbrellla etc). Spacious rooms for downtown, wonderfully decorated and included a large bathroom all freshly renovated. Excellent location, right downtown with many outdoor cafes close by. Situated in an area with narrow, cobblestone streets, tons of shopping and very little traffic. Enjoyed via del Corso(a few blocks away) which was a substantial shopping street that was alive with people at night, going for an evening stroll after dinner. Surprisingly close to Spanish steps & subway there(also busy at night) .We had a nice evening stroll to the Trevi fountain, Pantheon, and Piazza Navona. Breakfast was served on site, mine was included with room and it was not the usual croissant and coffee either. Computer in lobby with FREE internet (hard to find in Italy). We enjoyed our stay here, the service was outstanding. Nice B&B feel, not your usual downtown hotel. They made us at ease in a foreign city. We also stayed nearby at another hotel and it didnot compare, wanted to go back and visit this one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a terrific location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingPeteShow
Reviews.Content: I had initially booked a room in the Condotti Palace Apartment Hotel - run by the same people, just around the corner, and the two facilities share a reception desk. Upon checking in, I was told that the room I had booked was not available, as they were 'having electrical problems' over at Condotti Palace. I was advised that I was being moved into 'an annex' just down the road. Tripadvisor is full of horror stories from people being moved to lesser accommodation than they had booked (not necessarity with the Condotti group, but enough to make me concerned). I let them know I wasn't happy with that arrangement, and they moved me into a room in Hotel Condotti - and shouted me breakfast for the first morning. Hotel Condotti is clean and well presented. My new room although small (I estimated it was about 3.5m x 3.5m, plus ensuite) was well appointed, with a comfortable bed, good quality TV and a safe for valuables. The room was airconditioned, but you've also got the option of being able to open your window as well - a real bonus. The hotel has an elevator, and free computer/internet access in the lobby. The hotel is within a couple of minutes walk from the Spanish Steps and the metro station under the piazza. The Collosseum etc are about a 15 to 20 minute walk away. There are dozens of great restaurants within easy reach of the hotel. I'm confident that the hotel did everything it could to make me comfortable, given that the room I had booked was not available.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in a cupboard”
Reviews.Author: James H
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite for the hotel and were told on arrival that we had been upgraded to the "Top" suite. Not so exciting as it turned out - we had to climb a couple of flights of stairs past the elevator's top floor and found ourselves in a cupboard with a bathroom. Not all that bad but it had a very tired looking decor and it was impossible to use the shower as the roof was too low to stand up in. I didn't mind it too much as the location was almost perfect - just next door to the spanish steps and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “we had a lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: trevortalbot2
Reviews.Content: we have been to Rome several times for a holiday, but Hotel Condotti was by far our best choice of Hotels yet. It is in a marvelous position and the hotel and staff could not be more helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaR23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at HotelCondotti for a week and enjoyed our stay. Service was friendly and helpfull. Rooms were nicely decorated and the AC saved our trip! It was about 35c the whole week outside so it was really nice and relaxing to return to the cool hotel room. Location was absolutely perfect. Everything is a walk distance away or if you want to use the metro the Spagna stop is right next to the Hotel. If we ever return to rome we will be back at the hotel! Breakfast was ok, nothing special. Some of the bread or cakes were hard, milk warm and fruit soft. If you plan to eat breakfast I would propably go early in the morning when everything should be freash. (We went at about 9.30am)Wouldnt recomend the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Monsta1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel a few months before our trip to Rome so got a great price. The location was very central. Staff were friendly & helpful. Rooms were clean & sufficient in size, plus has air con which was a saviour during the heatwave we were in at the time. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel location and service”
Reviews.Author: octotrip
Reviews.Content: I traveled with 4 of my lady friends to Rome to first and foremost see the Vatican city (vatican museums, Sistine Chapel and the St. Peters Basilica) The hotel is situated almost in the center of all the cozy streets and alleys with lots of typical Italian restautants. The hotel is just a 2 minute walk to the spanish steps where all the shopping streets and boutiques are situated. The Metro is just around the corner of the Spanish steps and going to the vatican and other tourist spots in Rome. The hotel has a friendly staff and rooms are very tidy and clean. We will definitely stay again in Hotel Condotti next time we visit Rome. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Great central location two minutes from Spanish steps”
Reviews.Author: Livib
Reviews.Content: The hotel Condotti was very helpful even before arrival answering anybqueries I had sent by email. Upon arrival the front desk staff were extremely friendly and welcoming. We had booked two rooms, one being for our teenage children that although quite small and was at the very top of the hotel, did have very good air conditioning and was comfortable. The main issue with their room was the sloping ceiling making it awkward to install a Proper shower. Our own room was very comfortable and had the added benefit of a large balcony over thecfront of the hotel. All four of us made use of this after a hot day and evening meal. Breakfast has been adequate and is similar to most European hotel breakfasts. Contrary to other reviews we found that breakfast was plentiful and was repenished.

Reviews.Title: “Cant beat the Location.”
Reviews.Author: Mailmeifwrong
Reviews.Content: It's Location is great. Its clean , breakfast is basic but just around the corner you can get anything you desire at a really low cost (do not mean Babington's). Did get a better room rate contacting the Hotel directly. Restaurant next to it is quite good, Ninos also which is a couple of blocks away is worth Visiting for a meal.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: JennyBean186220
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our Honeymoon, and were very excited to stay in a lovely hotel (this one was the most expensive out of all of our hotels we stayed in.) However our hotel room was so small it could hardly fit in the double bed! The breakfast in the morning was a poor selection and the cerial selection was either cheap cornflakes or cheap museli. Within ten minutes of our arrival the table and chairs were taken from our balcony. When we asked at the reception about it we were told that they had to be replaced but in the four days we stayed there, we still had no table and chairs, which meant if you wanted to sit on the balcony, you has to sit on the floor! The only thing I can say about this hotel that is good is that the staff were helpful. Sorry, I just can't recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Gem boutique hotel in beautiful, small neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: SallyGreenwichCT
Reviews.Content: Hotel Condotti is a classic euro boutique hotel nestled in a small shopping area of Rome; 4 blocks from the Spanish Steps, and from the very chic shopping avenue of Rome. It is situated in a complex of small cobblestone streets filled with cafes, shops, gelaterias and Italian delis. Great location for wantering just where you are or setting off to other areas of Rome. The rooms are lovely - small/med as euro rooms will be, but well detailed. Bathrooms are roomy and modern. Most rooms have classic balconies with large shuuter that open onto the neighborhoods below. Staff was extremely helpful on all travel tips & helped arrange excursions.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: Matsol
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome having booked this boutique hotel for a surprise trip for my wife's 40th. I had read a few contraversial reviews but these all refered to the annex around the corner (which I will not comment on having not seen) so I booked a room in the main hotel building. The room was small, but immaculately clean with a brand new bathroom and wonderful air conditioning, which was a complete necessity at this time of year. There was a small restaurant at lower ground level which served an adequate breakfast of cereal, pastries, cold meats an omlettes along with juices and freshly made coffee and cappucino. The staff were probably the most helpful people in Rome and could advise in all tourist matters. Now the best bit.... LOCATION.... This hotel is right in the heart of old Rome. Just a few feet away from the Spanish Steps, a five minute walk from the Trevi Fountain, ten from the Pantheonand slightly further afield the Vatican and Colloseum at about 25 minutes walk. We did not have to use public transport once. To sum up, the rooms are small but quaintand full of character. The location is a fantastic base for seeing all of Rome. Prices are excellent and breakfast is a good start to the day. A most enjoyable stay. If you are looking for a swimming pool and not a base to tour from then this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but probably will not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: CmanScrufy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to locate and just a short walk from the Spanish Steps metro stop. We arrived before the normal check in time but the staff was helpful and after only a minimal wait they had our room ready and the porter helped us with our luggage. After reading other reviews I was expecting to be placed in the annex and we were (there was no information on the reservations stating that we were not in the main building). This is both good and bad. The annex was like having our own private apartment in Rome, we didn't have to walk through a hotel lobby and the door lead right into the street across from a decent little restaurant. The downside is that breakfast is served in the main hotel around the corner so it is not easy to just run downstairs and grab something to eat and the rooms are smaller in the annex I think (the hotel’s website do not show how small the rooms are). The room and bathroom were both tiny but similar to most hotel rooms in Italy. It was clean and well maintained. The shower was notably tiny though a little over 2 feet square. The breakfast was ok but not really worth the extra money, there are plenty of little cafes that are available for breakfast around. The rooms also had free WiFi access that was good enough for Skype. The TV is very small but has a few English channels. Also as a note to travelers the room does not have an iron or ironing board due to the fire hazard. During the stay we used the coffee pot and cups and they were never replaced through the three nights we stayed. Also the walls are paper thin. Not normally a problem because most tourists are quiet and go to sleep at decent times. Unfortunately we had two teenage girls staying next to us that came in at around one in the morning and proceeded to talk on their phones and to each other loudly for over an hour and would not get the hint when we knocked on their door and the wall. The walls are also so thin we could hear one of the girls talking quietly with her boyfriend and later even hear their phone vibrating. I never noticed any noise from the streets during the entire stay. Overall a decent hotel with friendly and helpful staff. The location is great; near a metro, the Spanish Steps and the shopping district. But for the price I would have hoped for a better breakfast, accommodations and knowledge of where the room was going to be located. Probably will not stay here again due to the fact that there are other hotels around for similar prices and we would like to stay in a different part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “I loved Rome and the Hotel COndotti was a great place to stay. I'd stay there again and recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: Sirin666
Reviews.Content: Great location! Romolo and the female at the front desk(Paula?) were wonderful! They were extremely helpful and accurate with recommendations regarding things to see, tour companies, places to eat, etc. There was a night man who was almost useless seemingly more interested in anything else but customer service. Most of the staff speaks English well. The breakfast was great but ask them to make you a coffee instead of the machine which produces mediocre coffeee/cappuccino/espresso at best. The room was small but adequate. Climate control was great. Free wifi is inconsistent at best. We received BBC on the tv about half the time then it went out and the hotel was unable to remediate it but you're not there for tv anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: saraelizabeth26
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the end of July for 5 nights with 9 other family members. We enjoyed the hotel very much. The breakfast was very good, staff very helpful and courteous. The front desk staff, Romolo in particular, was very pleasant and helpful. The rooms were very clean, beds were comfortable. The location of the hotel is very nice, the Spanish Steps were less than a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Our family was recommended to 2 restaurants during our stay, one excellent and one terrible. We were recommended to Malafemmina for dinner, the service was atrocious and food was mediocre. DO NOT go to Malafemmina if recommended, our family was treated so terribly there that all left angry. We were also recommended to Ristorante De Degliamici which is near hotel, this was my favorite restaurant in Rome, food was absolutely wonderful as was the staff. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “central location”
Reviews.Author: Lucia1959
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was lovely in a very central part of Rome just around the corner from the Spanish Steps and Via Condotti. The rooms were ok a little small but very clean and nice. We were in Rome for three days and I must say everything was very central. Walking distance to most places close to the metropolitan train station. The breakfast is ok can improve if you go down at 9.30 the is nothing much left and they don't replenish the food. I think they can improve on this for the price you pay they should. Otherwise the hotel is clean central and the staff a very helpful and speak good english. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: Bandy34
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights 'around the corner' in a beautiful room with large fully equipped bathroom . Room on second floor overlooked the Via della Croce. Very quiet when window shut & (also very quiet & efficient) air conditioning on. Watching the busy street scene from our window was part of the evening entertainment. Paula & Romolo on reception who both spoke perfect English were charming & ever helpful. Hotel location minutes from the Spanish Steps is ideal for sightseeing. Had some of the best meals ever in Blanco Ristorante a couple of doors along. Hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice staff”
Reviews.Author: tomodhabi
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the front desk was pleasant, accommodating and had a sense of humor. I speak English so Romolo and Paula were particularly helpful. Romolo speaks a beautiful brand of British English and Paula is a Canadian. They're both knowledgeable about the area. They helped us get tours and taxis. The rooms were small and basic and the breakfast was in the basement and I used it just as fuel. Very basic. But that was fine because you can spend the rest of the day eating the most delicious meals. The location is wonderful. In no time, you're able to find your way to everything you need. Again, kudos to the front-desk staff. If I go back to Rome, I will book at the Condotti.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: love_to_roam_pa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Condotti in July 2011. It was my first time in Rome so admittedly I don't have much to compare it to in the city but it was a great experience. Walking distance to most tourist sites if you don't mind walking a bit. We stayed in one of the "annex" buildings and the room was a size I've come to expect in mid-priced accommodations in European cities: not huge, but clean with a good-sized bed. What set this place apart for me was the staff. They were very friendly and helpful. The woman who took care of breakfast was unbelievable. She was so on top of things, so cheerful, and made sure everyone got what (s)he wanted/needed. We will come back if we're in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paradize50
Reviews.Content: Superb location in the trendy shopping district and very close to the Metro and Spanish steps.Our room was unusually large with a great bathroom. Highly efficient and speedy air-conditioning. Quiet too. Front desk staff, particularly Romolo and Vladimir were excellent. Wish the outdoor roof top patio was open air.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and beautiful rooms!”
Reviews.Author: cowtowntravelers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. I was in search of a good priced, quaint and well located hotel in Rome. We loved our stay at the Hotel Condotti. The room was large and had a huge bathroom (a bathtub with a shower) and a spacious sitting room. There was a tiny elevator that you could ride or carry one bag in, but the stairs were always free. :) The hotel is about a 2 minute walk to the Spanish steps, metro and shopping streets. Breakfast is served in the morning and we arrived about 15 minutes before the end of breakfast and everything was picked over. There was canned fruit salad and hard croissants. That was the only negative. There is an excellent restaurant/bar on the corner the street that we enjoying going to after dinner. I would recommend this hotel to anyone! We hope to come back again. ***The hotel offers a 60 Euro limo/town car (for 2 people) from the hotel to the airport. We did this and it was a tremendous help to not have to worry about taking the train or a taxi to the airport. It made the end of our trip incredibly easy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: JudyG14
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for four nights early July. When we checked into the hotel we were taken to our room on the second floor. Although the room itself was fine, the view from the window was awful. Instead of a city or courtyard view as described in the details, we looked out onto the back of a property (about 6' away) with air conditioning ducts and an awful concrete construction. This made the room very dark and depressing. We asked if we could be moved to another room but there was nothing available that night. The staff were really helpful though and said if we could stay in that room for one night, we could be moved into a room in the annexe (just round the corner 30 metres away) the following night. We went to have a look at the annexe rooms which were much nicer and moved into there for the remaining three nights - we had a courtyard view and the room was much brighter. All the staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a great location very close to the Spanish Steps and we walked everywhere during our stay. The Continental breakfast was fine with cereals, yoghurts, cheese, meats, tomatoes, bread rolls, croissants and pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, friendly staff, great value”
Reviews.Author: Rippydog
Reviews.Content: Rome is an eyewateringly expensive place to go to but the Hotel Condotti was an oasis of good value. The staff were superb, very friendly, efficient and all multilingual. We needed to change room because the loo wouldn't flush. There was no drama, no histrionics, it was just done without fuss and an apology for putting us out. I almost felt like apologising to them, they were so nice about it. If we go to Rome again I'd have no hesitation booking in to the Condotti and for longer this time.

Reviews.Title: “Spendid hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: korcula19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights while attending a family wedding in Rome. The Reception staff on arrival and during our stay were very friendly and helped with every query we asked. The hotel is situated in a very central location near the Spanish Steps, shops, restaurants and easy access to all the main sights. The Restaurant 34 is next door and is our favourite restaurant in Rome. We will definitely stay in this hotel next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect setting in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mshoo
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Condotti - location, ambiance, service and decor. Stayed here with our college age kids in a suite. I must admit the suite was a bit tight with 4 but we managed just fine and enjoyed our room over the cobblestone street below. The terrific breakfast spread was the perfect start to a day of exploring Rome. The staff at the hotel was incredibly helpful with any request - from cabs to internet service. Walk out the door into a delightful shopping area of Rome. Around the corner from the famous Spanish Steps and on to Borghese Gardens. We would definitely stay here again and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location and great Service”
Reviews.Author: Dax82
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 nights at Hotel Condotti with a party of four including 2 kids. We highly recommend this hotel for its attentive service, perfect location, pleasant ambience. It is a 3 star hotel so the rooms are small but they are very clean and functional. Our rooms overlooked the sunny backyard and were very quiet. The atmosphere around the hotel at night is simply perfect for a Roman holiday. We really appreciated the concierge's assistance to book guides and transportation. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: john101010
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple stayed at the hotel for 3 days before a cruise. Loved every minute, Great location, great staff, Paula was very helpful. 2-3 minutes to Spanish Steps and 10 to Trevi Fountain. Metro is very close we took it to the Colseum but walked back. We all would stay at this hotel again. Restaurant next door, A1 34 is one of the best!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable, on a quiet street in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ELF820
Reviews.Content: Our time at Hotel Condotti was great. The front desk staff was helpful and accommodating (we were allowed to check-in early once a room became available - which was great after a long flight). The location is ideal - near the Spanish Steps - conducive to seeing many sights nearby (Pantheon, Trevi fountain, etc.). There is a great restaurant around the corner Fior Fiore serving the best pizza we tasted in Italy!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION, FRIENDLY STAFF and SUPER CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: Franemmi
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our long weekend in Rome where we stayed at the Annex of hotel Condotti and absolutely loved it! Hotel has an absolutely perfect location where we did not have to take a metro or a taxi while visiting Roma sights and even Vatican. Our hotel room was very clean and spacey so absolutely nothing to complain about. Beds are spacious (we stayed at a twin room) and the bathroom was very clean + included shower gels, soaps and shampoos. Breakfast was lovely; very tasty pastry's, ham& cheese, bread, yogurts, grapefruit and orange juices and cornflakes. You could either have a black coffee from a machine at the buffet table or order coffee latte, hot chocolate or a real Italian cappuccino from the hotel staff working in the breakfast room. There was no extra charge for that. Our hotel rate was EUR 340.00 for two nights incl. breakfast which seems high, but for such a perfect location, high season and clean + comfortable hotel room we did not mind paying. We both hope to come back to Rome soon again and will definitely stay again at the hotel Condotti. If you are planning their visit to Rome, consider staying here, you will def. not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “ONE REALLY BOUTIQUE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: efidoucata
Reviews.Content: excellent location to visit everything in Rome. the service from reception was very good. the breakfast room was underground but everything fresh and the coffee excelent.

Reviews.Title: “Great, comfortable Hotel. Great Location. Friendly Staff !”
Reviews.Author: AHarty
Reviews.Content: First trip to Rome with two small children. Had a quad room. Very clean, comfortable and welcomed by Angelo at reception who was most helpful and friendly ! Overlooked the Street and heard Italian music from the restuarant below. Was great ! Great location, close to Spanish Steps and Condotti street. Will gladly recommend ! Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, good-sized room”
Reviews.Author: HKDee
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on Trip Advisor we were afraid all the rooms in Europe would be shoebox-sized, but we were pleasantly surprised that all our hotels were good-sized (esp. compared to Japan!) and in fantastic locations. Hotel Condotti is a small boutique hotel a few meters away from the Spanish Steps and Via Condotti, but away from the crowds and noise of both places. Everything important is about a 10-20 minute walk away (Trevi, Tritone fountains, Piazza Popolo) and there are very good restaurants a few streets away (Da Cesaretto, Nino, Antico Caffe Greco). The room decor was a bit dated (I think they have more modern rooms in their sister properties) and there were no views but since we only slept there it didn't matter. Breakfast was average, but there are so many other places to eat at so that wasn't an issue as well. You can't expect resort-like humongous breakfast buffets in small properties anyway. Plus you will be too busy planning your day to spend lots of time over breakfast! If you are looking for luxury, book at luxury-hotel prices. If you are looking for relative comfort and convenience with good service, then you can consider Hotel Condotti.

Reviews.Title: “Inattentive and rude staff in an overpriced hotel”
Reviews.Author: GaryChris
Reviews.Content: The desk staff was very condescending and inattentive during our entire stay. The room and bathroom were very small even for Italy. The breakfast room was dingy, dark and the walls were dirty. The breakfast was minimal and even the coffee was watery. The location is good for the Spanish step area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, small rooms but who cares”
Reviews.Author: jett123
Reviews.Content: Great price and fantastic location. The rooms were really small but it doesnt matter since Rome is so fabulous that you are not going to be be in the room. Staff friendly. wifi present Right near the Spanish steps and Shopping

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jasmina M
Reviews.Content: the location is literally perfect, the service is very good (kind staff). the only small flaw are the tiny rooms...but in the city like Rome, you don't really spend so much time in your room!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bmoore229
Reviews.Content: This is a ver conveniently located, cozy boutique hotel. The staff was super nice. Again, location, location, location. A couple of drawbacks were that our room was tiny. Now I'm not comparing it to our ridiculously large US hotels. The rooms are simply tiny. But given the location and the staff, we wold heartily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel out of 5 hotels we stayed in while in Italy”
Reviews.Author: LJucha
Reviews.Content: After being on a tour in Italy for 8 days, we came to the Hotel Condotti for 2 days of Rome sightseeing on our own. Imagine our surprise to come to the room overlooking the cobblestone street, with wonderful music from the restaurants below that we could hear from the balcony outside our room! We opened up the doors and windows and thoroughly enjoyed the beautiful weather and the views from the room! (414). The staff (rodolfo i think?) was very nice and helpful. We ate next door and it was very good. Fabulously located by spanish steps, but not too close that the hoards of crowds there were an issue. We walked all over to the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, the Capitol and all the way to Trastevere. We had an absolutely lovely stay there and have already told my travel agent what a gem it was and will highly suggest it to friends heading to Rome and would stay again without question. Breakfast is included but you have to know that they aren't the same as here but thats ok... we didn't mind. They did have free wifi which was nice as there are not free hotspots all over.

Reviews.Title: “A cosy hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: AnnAinRome
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Codotti in April 2011. The hotel has superb location in one of the most picturesque parts of Rome. Many sightseeings are in the walking distance as well as the best high fashion shops. The room has clean and neat though not very spacious (but it is quite common in Ilaty). The only problem was heating, the first days of our stay it was a bit cold. Breakfast was fine with fresh cappucino and a variety of bakery, cereals and meat&cheese. I would definitely recommend the hotel to young groups and couples who are in for sightseeing or shopping. Have a nice stay in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Rip off; they'll book you in their "annex" rooms without telling you and they aren't any better than yr worst motel.”
Reviews.Author: BNCtravellingbuds
Reviews.Content: Made reservations for 3 consecutive nights, double rm, 2 months in advance, and recv'd confirmation. Arrived only to be told we had to spend 1st night in their "Stay Inn" annex several blocks away which was tiny, dark n miserable and not even worth $60 much less the $200 /night rate I had paid. They agreed to move our bags the next day to our room at the main hotel for the following two nights. When the room was ready in the afternoon, lo and behold once again it was not at the hotel main address, but at yet another "annex" hotel, the Palace, which was another block away and still not much better! For the $600+ taxes spent I was outraged n complained vehemently to the manager who was only available on checkout Monday morning. He did give me a partial credit, but I immediately contacted my credit card company for a credit. I feel their website misrepresents the rooms n locations of the accommodations they provided, and the rates they charged for what was given highway robbery! Find another hotel if u can - I would not trust any confirmation from this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: AHine_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Yes the room was a little compact but perfectly acceptable and spotlessly clean. In room tea and coffee making facilities would be an improvement but it is not unusual in this part of the world that these are not provided. The breakfast was not varied but again very acceptable and the singing / whistling waiter helped to set the tone for the day. The remaining staff were always charming, helpful, polite and knowledgeable. The location is perfect and for us meant that we walked everywhere as everything that we wanted was within a suitable distance. As for price, we considered that the stay represented value for money. Yes if ever we return to Rome, we will look first for the Hotel Condotti!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: pilarkitty
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Condotti was an enjoyable one. The street where it's located is absolutely beautiful. It's just steps away from first class shopping, the Spanish Steps, and the Rome subway system. You couldn't ask for a better location. All the major tourist attractions are within a half hour walk through pedestrian friendly routes. The reason we chose this hotel was for the free wifi since the international data plan through AT&T is very expensive. The hotel is small, but that's to be expected for a European hotel. Breakfast was very good. Make sure to ask the person working to make you a fresh cafe or cappuccino instead of using the machine. They were much better. You have to ask, he won't offer. The only downside to the hotel is the beds themselves. They were very firm and only one pillow per person was provided. I woke up a few times with pins and needles in my arms. Other than that, I can't say a single negative thing about the hotel. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Rodnall
Reviews.Content: The hotel Condotti is a nice little hotel in a PERFECT LOCATION, literally one block from the Spanish Steps and minutes away from the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, etc. The rooms are small by United States standards but average size for a 3 star hotel in Europe. Paula was extremely cheerful and helpful with tips on places to see and eat, etc. & the price was extremely reasonable given the great location of the hotel. I would stay here again and recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Rome, as long as you aren't trying to fit more than 2 people to the room. Anyway, you plan to spend more time in the city than the room and if you want to be in a prime location to site see, then the Hotel Condotti is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay again.”
Reviews.Author: BCSTravelclub
Reviews.Content: Not open for discussion. Would never stay again. The location of the Condotti is the only acceptable thing about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect location, spotless room”
Reviews.Author: Maureen041
Reviews.Content: After moving from an unacceptable room in another hotel we felt very fortunate to find a beautifully renovated, spotless room for our family of four. Our suite had 1.5 baths and the full bath was exceptional. The location was superior to any other area we visited in Rome. It was an easy walk to Trevi Fountain, The Pantheon and the Spanish Steps were just steps away. The staff was very helpful and the Metro and taxi's were easily accessible. Excellent shopping, restaurants and cafe's just outside the hotel. We stayed in the portion of the hotel around the corner from the lobby. Maureen

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Base for Exploring Rome”
Reviews.Author: MicahDF
Reviews.Content: The Condotti Hotel has a great staff, good rooms, and a perfect location for touring Rome. We stayed for three nights and had a great experience. The room had a good bed and was clean. Although the hotel is in a relatively busy area for pedestrian traffic we noticed no noise and had no problems sleeping. By American standards, the bathroom is small but typical for Rome. The there was only a shower and no bathtub. My only complaint, which I did not share with management, was that the bidet had a bit of an odor. I regret that we didn't say anything because I'm sure they would have tried to correct it, but it just wasn't that big of an issue for us. But the room is not the best part of the Condotti, it is the location. You are just a short walk from the Spanish Steps, a metro stop, and many shops and restaurants. We walked to every site we went to in Rome, the Vatican (the longest walk at 35 minutes), the Borghese, the Pantheon, the Trevi Fountain, the Colosseum, and other destinations. It is true that there is no parking at the hotel, but you won't need a car because everything is so accessible. The staff was also very helpful and friendly. Angelo, was particularly helpful and recommended the best restaurant we ate at during our week in Italy (il Margutta, just a few blocks from the hotel). Everyone was kind from the cleaning staff to the front desk. The hotel will gladly take your bags if you show up early from a red-eye flight before your room is ready. The complimentary breakfast is simple, but good - croissants, cereal, yogurt, cold cuts, and cheese. There is also a computer with internet access in the lobby that is free to use. So, leave your car behind and stay at the Condotti Hotel for a perfect base to explore Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust0446
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had a chance of staying in this hotel for 4 nights. We were in the hotel's back building which they call palace. It is not a palace though and there was none of the luxury and amenities of a real palace. Our room was very tidy and clean and so was the bathroom/toilet. I liked their beautiful toilet and bathroom fixtures indeed typical of Italian designs. Everyday, the towels were changed and the beds were done. Our room had a small veranda in a courtyard allowing us to open the door which was free from street noise. The room though was not very sound proof. We could hear people's conversation, their coming in and out. The location is superb for it is on a cobbled street parallel to a very busy street where all the luxury boutiques can be found. The very famous Spanish Steps is two minutes away by foot and the Fontana de Trevi, a good 10 minute walk. A metro station is just a stone's throw and if you get tired shopping you have access via the entrance of the metro station to the gardens of Villa Borghese. We had our fresh coffee and croissant in nearby Mac donald, which avoided us paying Euro 10.00 per person for breakfast in the hotel. I had problem with my knee when I arrived so I asked the reception if there would be a doctor who could come in case the situation worsens. I was assured there would be. Luckily, I did not have to call the doctor.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Tucks_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Condotti for 5 nights it was absolutely marvellous, the location just perfect for exploring Rome and its sights. The hotel staff could not have been more helpful and knowledgable. The Rooms were beautifully furnished and spotlessly clean. The only comment I would make that there are no tea or coffee making facilities in the room but otherwise it was perfect. We definately staff here again and it was a truly memorable holiday

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: TypicalTuscan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at this wonderful hotel. As our first trip to Rome, we were kindly welcomed by a bubbly staff with bright smiles. We were particularly fond of a desk clerk, Vlado whose perfect English and sense of humor could delight anyone after long hours of traveling/touring. The location of Hotel Condotti is excellent, for you are right in the heart of designer shops and boutiques with the Spanish Steps just around the corner. The rooms are clean and cozy. We had a beautiful view from the terrace, which was nice to relax on after a full day of sightseeing. The continental breakfast had a wide variety of food items and enough to prepare us for the lengthy days ahead. Morning, day, and night our presence never went unnoticed as we were greeted by every employee, willing to satisfy the tiniest requests. Hotel Condotti fulfilled all of our needs and more. It was an amazing hotel and we will be sure to stay there for every visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Hospitality, Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: EdwardYoung
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in an excellent location close to Spagna metro so easy to get to the Airport via Termini. Also close to most of the tourist attractions, Rome is pretty easy place to walk across in a day so nothings too far away. Rooms were clean if a little small, we stayed in the main hotel and found they were nicely decorated. Breakfast was ok, everything was fresh and nicely titivated by the attentive guy who runs the breakfast room. Staff very friendly and happy to help and made the stay very pleasant. Would certainly return again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location -just beware of different room types and know what you've booked!”
Reviews.Author: Tiina10022011
Reviews.Content: Location couldn't be better, charming area with all main sights within easy walking distance, lot of good restaurants and shopping streets just around the corner. The hotel has 2 separate parts; the actual hotel and the apartment hotel - we had booked for the apartment hotel but our room, although located in the apartment block, was a small standard hotel room without even any basic apart hotel facilities (room 209), which was bit of a let-down because we booked very early. According to the fire plan the other rooms were more spacious. However small, the room was kept very clean; even towels were changed every day (which is a unnecessary, really). No noice from the streets could be heard inside the apart hotel room which was great for sleeping - only the beds, at least in our room, were rock hard so it took a bit of getting used to, also walls are very thin so you could hear everything from the neighbouring rooms. Breakfast was not included as we were in the so-called apartment hotel -although without any facilities for self-catering- but it was very good value for the eur10 cost. Reception service was mainly good and professional, the unfortunate exception being one of the younger receptionists doing late shifts; there was a problem with the toilet in our room, and he stated point blank he there was nothing he could do about it, that there was no other rooms available and hung up the phone... Fortunately his extremely helpful colleague sorted the things out and even got us another room - thumbs up for his attitude and professionalism! But despite of small hick-ups, nice hotel and excellent location, would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: keenerDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Terrific location and clean hotel. However, the rooms are tiny, I felt like a giant. We had a great balcony attached but it was too cold to use it. Clean. Breakfast utterly missable. But still a great location

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great service!”
Reviews.Author: ArifIbrahim
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife spent 7 nights at this hotel. We arrived very early in the morning. The reception staff, Vladimir, who speaks very fluent English, tried his best to get us a room but as expected, no room is available. The statndard check-in time is 2pm anyway. He was kind enough to store our luggages and he also helped us to arrange for a half-day city tour of Rome while we wait for our room. We came back to the hotel around 2pm and by then all of luggages are already in our room! The room is very clean with good amenities.
