Please note that there are no facilities to boil your own water in the room! Breakfast is part of the deal, served at the basement in a rather cramp space. The menu are the same everyday. Since, we stayed there for 7 days, we wish to have more varieties. The best part of this hotel is the location. If you are into shopping, nothing beats this location. Just a few meters away from the hotel is the famous Via Condotti where you will find your Gucci, LV, Prada, Burberry, Jimmy Choo, etc., etc. If you are not into high end and branded stuffs, there are still many, many shops and boutiques around the hotel. There's also a supermarket and a pharmacy nearby if you need to get any stuff. The hotel does not have F&B outlets but that is not a problem because there are many restaurants around the hotel. The italian restaurant just next to the hotel serve authentic italian dishes with very reasonable price. We had dinner 4 times at the same restaurant and very happy with the food and prices. As for tourist attractions, Spanish Steps is just 3 minutes away by walking. Other attractions such as Pantheon, Trevi Fountains, and many others are also very much within walking distance. As for the rate, since we stayed for 7 nights, we got one night free of charge. Also, the hotel provide one-way airport transfer (airport to hotel) free of charge if you stay longer. The driver was very promt and he waited for us at 6.30am at the arrival hall. We were driven in a Mercedes to the hotel. We asked the hotel to arrange for our airport transfer (from hotel to airport) which cost us 60euro. We were driven to the airport with a Jaguar!!! Not bad at all since if you take the normal cab, it will still cost you at least Euro45 to go to the airport but you may be driven in a very compact car which cannot fit your big luggages. As for services, I have no complain at all since all the staff are very helpful and courteous. More importantly, they speak very fluent English which is important to people like us who doesn't know a word of italian.

Reviews.Title: “A high quality hotel with sincere, thorough and bubbly staff.”
Reviews.Author: PilgrimSB
Reviews.Content: The Condotti is a little haven set in a greeat location. Its facilities are very good, and will certainly make you comfortable, but the real stand out is the staff. They are hard-working, friendly and enthusiastic, and prepared to go out of their way to help. As a first time traveller to Rome, they helped unobtrusively to make it a terrific experience. Rome has so many sights - and the Condotti is especially well-placed for those who'd like to go nuts shopping - and the hotel itself is a calm, well run and trustworthy place to stay in the middle of a very hectic city. I was especially grateful for their assistance in organising transport to Fiumicino on the last day of my trip, especially in the light of some sort of transport strike that disrupted traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: liisi_82
Reviews.Content: Simple but nice hotel. Great location and friendly staff, especially the one doing night shift. Room was clean and beautiful. However, the beds and pillows were very uncomfortable and the breakfast was quite simple.

Reviews.Title: “My second stay in the great Condotti, will be back asap- Una”
Reviews.Author: dinah1Dublin
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, wonderful staff, comfortable and spotless rooms, nice breakfast, Metro and top boutiques on the doorstep, as well as great restaurants... Not to mention Rome's unparalleled antiquities and culture. Heaven. Una, Dublin

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING PERFECT HOTEL PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: dawnycooko
Reviews.Content: me and my husband arrived home late last night, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here at the condotti, the rooms were spacious we had a large room in the condotti palace, vladimir is fantastic and nothing troubles him, the location is perfect as everything is within walking distance, i have to say the food in the surrounding area was a little let down and i would recommend going to the piazza navona for your food, back to the hotel, amazing and would definately be recommending this to friends and family, and will go back there if my travels ever be luckily enough to return me to rome,

Reviews.Title: “location location”
Reviews.Author: gopies99
Reviews.Content: the hotel was in a very convenient location metro was literally 100m away shops and eateries everywhere loved the pizza place around the corner the service was friendly and informative when we locked ourselves out of the room, they organised to get us back in very quickly free wifi was also included and a desktop computer in the lobby for internet use the provided breakfast was the best throughout italy (florence and venice) that I experienced the room was nice but I stayed in the top room which was an experience the room did not have a flat ceiling, but slanted like in an attic although this was not a major problem for me, since I am not overly tall, it may be for someone who is taller than 170cm. The shower did not have a shower curtain so a lot of the water ended up on the floor, and it became very wet. I also constantly bumped my head on the ceiling while having a shower because the ceiling was low. But overall the hotel was in a convenient location and the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ALivingston727
Reviews.Content: My friend and I are both pretty low maintenance, so we didn't need anything over the top. The rooms were small and the bathroom was tiny, but it was a clean, safe, quiet place to sleep after wandering the streets of Rome all day. The staff was friendly. We got a great deal over Christmas and New Years which included Transportation from the Airport, breakfast every morning and one free night after staying 6. If you are looking for a luxury place to stay there may be other ones that are better suited, BUT the location is perfect! The end of the street is literally the begining of the Piazza de Spagna. It is within a short walking distance to EVERYTHING in Rome, including Vatican City. It is a great deal for people who want to see the city and are less concerned with where they are staying. It is a safe place to leave belongings and go off for the entire day. The only downside was that the bathroom had a funky smell that we couldn't figure out, but it was bearable if the door wasn't left closed all day.

Reviews.Title: “Location and staff perfect”
Reviews.Author: Rome201019
Reviews.Content: Very friendly concierge team, Vladimir & company are perfect. Room was good size ,clean & comfortable. It is great for a romantic stay. Thank you for everything guys.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel location with friendly staff and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sharonj64
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights. Loved the hotel location. Quaint hotel room with good bed, shower and little balcony facing away from street. Hence, nice & quiet at night. Close to main shopping and Spanish Steps. We walked to every tourist attraction in Rome. Everything pretty central and easy to get orientated. Only drawcard for us was shuttle dropped us off near Mc Donalds and we were weary after long flight from Australia, so took us a bit to find hotel initially; and could not get into room until 1 or 2pm. Wpuld have loved a shower to perk up before exploring Rome. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “The best holiday of my life”
Reviews.Author: Mostar_10
Reviews.Content: Great location and even better hotel staff. Surprising Vladimir, friendly receptionist, always ready answer at all on all possible and impossible questions. Highly recomended

Reviews.Title: “Bellissimo Hotel, Bellissima City”
Reviews.Author: Eurotraveler7777
Reviews.Content: A group of us, friends for years, recently met up in Rome for a long weekend. Two of us stayed at the Hotel Condotti, and from comparing notes afterward, it seems we got the best hotel of the bunch, so praise indeed. In a great location for everything that Rome has to offer, with the metro less than a minute away and an abundance of great cafes and restaurants within walking distance, the Condotti was everything we could have wished for in a Rome hotel. Clean, comfortable rooms, nice bathrooms and extremely friendly and helpful staff. Romolo on the front desk was particularly helpful and a big part of why we enjoyed our stay there so much. I think he would even have tried to arrange a private audience with His Holiness if we had asked. Nothing was too much trouble. So, thank you Hotel Condotti for making our stay in Rome so fantastic. We hope to do it again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Super location, service and value”
Reviews.Author: RERD09
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located one block from the Spanish Steps and the Metro. It is small and comfortable. We loved it. We requested a room with a terrace when we booked. They could not promise it but were able to give us one when we arrived. It was great. We bought wine, cheese and meats around the corner and enjoyed them on the terrace. The room was somewhat small but very nicely appointed and with a nice bathroom. It was very clean and housekeeping was good. The Desk staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included and was average fare but there was plenty to eat and the expresso machine was nice. Free WIFI was great, too. We stayed 4 nights. We read reviews ahead and were aware some people had been placed in other properties owned by Condotti that were nearby. We requested upon booking that we be in the main hotel and the staff were very accomodating. They confirmed by email that we were in the hotel. When we arrived our room was in the hotel and was very nice. We did, however, hear a man at the desk saying that he didn't know he was getting a room down the street. I think this confusion can be averted by good communication. The staff was very prompt in getting back with us by email. They were wonderful. We had a wonderful time there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: TravelBuzz93
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to Condotti Hotel we were told they didn't have room for us for our first night of three because they were installing a lift, and they had arranged for us to stay at San Carlo Hotel a few steps around the corner. We were not surprised that we were diverted because we had read earlier reviews that had warned of this practice, but it was still a little inconvenient since we were traveling with another couple who did have a room at Condotti. The room at Condotti was VERY small. There was not even enough room to walk around opened luggage, but it was clean and comfortable. The staff was adequate but not overly attentive. We would probably try a different hotel in the same area on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Condotti is all you will need for you stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DelPerthWA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to everything, a supermarket just two streets away and the Spanish Steps 2 streets away, a fab little restaurants in the examination street and all around. WIFI is free and the rooms are small but very clean. The laundry service is expensive though so try to find somewhere to do your own washing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: travelbuddy76
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a perfect location for the area of Piazza Spagna. The room was clean and nice and staff was nice. Breakfast was ok, the usual, nothing to brag about. Restaurants are around the corner though for nice walking. Lots of high end shopping around the corner also. Recommend it. Staff arranged for taxi to airport, might have been a little pricey - 60 euros, but it is about 45-60 minutes to airport. Driver showed up on time and was adequate. Best part, was clean room and great location. Take a taxi to hotel, could never find it on your own, between the tourists and small roads.

Reviews.Title: “a fantastic location and great value”
Reviews.Author: petite_puce81
Reviews.Content: very good value, close to the centre, lovely location, bathroom and bedroom very clean. hotel staff were polite and helpful. we had a problem with a squeaky laundry cupboard door outside our room the first night that kept banging, we reported it in the morning and it was fixed before we went to bed that evening. breakfast perfectly ok and in line with standards of a 3* hotel. only complaint would be that the coffee at breakfast was just ok and we expected better when in Italy, and had to go outside to a coffee bar to get our fix of espresso/capuccino in the morning! would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Let down by lack of customer care”
Reviews.Author: cwningen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. Rooms are small but clean. The staff were friendly on the whole but when we left we were accused of taking 3 bottles of water from the mini bar. Also we left too early for breakfast on the final day. A nice touch would have been to offer us a small bag of eg. pastries to take with us. I know it's a small point, but we had paid for 5 breakfasts and only got 4!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: llvllitchy
Reviews.Content: We started our Rome trip with an airport pick up form the hotel. Our driver was already there when we arrived and well worth the extra money! The hotel is in a great location -near the spanish steps and in a great area if you like to shop! The rooms were nice size and clean. The only downside would be that I like having a cup of tea in my room but there isn't any kettle or cups to drink from. The breakfast had a good range of food. The staff are friendly. The free wifi was great! I was a bit unsure about the health and safety of the stairs however. The cleaning staff seem to leave all the towels and laundry bags all over the stairs and landing everyday. It looks really messy and I can understand that there is little room to put towels etc while cleaning but they seem to be abandoned.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: VanJenn
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay at the Hotel Condotti last month. We were upgraded to the main hotel, which is just steps from the Spanish Steps, the shopping district, and plenty of wonderful little restaurants. The location was perfect for our 4-day stay in Rome - we were able to walk to all of the major tourist sites without having to figure out the public transit system. Our room was small but clean and comfortable. All members of the staff that we interacted with were pleasant. While we wouldn't have paid separately for it, the included breakfast was sufficient and convenient. Overall, a great place to stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “The best location”
Reviews.Author: Monika87
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel. It was located few steps from Spagna. There were many cosy restaurants with gardens nearby. The staff was very helpful. Negative things: very noisy so we couldn´t sleep, very poor breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room, clean and well appointed bathroom, helpful staff,”
Reviews.Author: t2f2
Reviews.Content: Angelo at the hotel was invaluable. We asked him about a gelateria, pizza place and he directed us to the best restaurant we went to in Sangalla. Anything we wanted he was there to help out. The guy downstairs with the daily breakfast was great too. The room was a normal smaller European room, but it was all we needed. It was clean and the bathroom was clean and very nice. I highly recommend this hotel. Most of all, the location of this hotel is UNREAL, right next to the Spanish Steps and the Spagna Metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Service & a Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: PatricioRomeo
Reviews.Content: My lovely girlfriend booked us a trip to Rome for my birthday. Our expectations were conservative as you never know how a hotel is going to until you get there. Upon arrival we were pleasantly greeted and was taken to our room. The staff spoke very good English I would add. Our room was actually situated away from the main hotel reception, but to our benefit. It mean that with our own key it was like having your own apartment in the best location in Rome imo. As you are literally next to all the designer shops and the cool Spanish steps were a stones throw away. I could go on as it is all positive. Only thing that was average was the breakfast, just your basic juice, toast, tea, coffee etc. However there are so great many places to eat so you are spoilt for choice really.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Location...Very helpful staff..Thanks Vladimir!!”
Reviews.Author: ashroff
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel was Vladimir - the most helpful front desk man ever! He was extremely astute at helping us plan our short visit in a way that we managed to see all the sites of note and eat at some fabulous restaurants! Vladimir - thanks!! Rooms are a tad small but clean and comfortable. Bathrooms were roomy by european standards. But the best part of all was the location. Absolutely fabulous! Within walking distance to everything of note in Rome except for the Vatican which is 5 mins by cab..Good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Bellisima Roma!”
Reviews.Author: DeanneLS
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed at the Condotti Hotel from August 17 ro 21, then one more night on the 23rd and loved every minute of being there! All of the staff were so very helpful and nice, warm and welcoming and made us feel like family. The rooms were very comfortable and nice, the bathrooms were nice and clean and always felt safe, even rolling in at 3:30am!! We never had an issue with noise between rooms. Breakfast was simple but hit the spot and the Capuccino's were awesome! The central location of this hotel is perfect as you are seconds from the Spanish Steps and well within walking distance of almost all the attractions and Piazza's in Rome. We walked very easily from the Colloseum "home", to Trastevere and back, Piazza Navona, Campo de Fiore, Piazza del Popolo, Trevi Fountain. You are also right at via Condotti and via del Corso - the main shopping streets. There are a few restaurants right on the street beneath the hotel and 34 was our favourite for the Gnocchi with 4 cheeses. The Fior Fiore Pizza around the corner has the best pizza! There are also some nice restaurants above the Spanish Steps for appertivo's at night. Even at night, 2 girls walking "home" alone most nights from Piazza Navona at 1:30am and one night at 3:30am from Trastevere we were perfectly safe and never felt uneasy. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to be right in the heart of Rome and can't wait to go back. Hotel Condotti is my hotel of choice in bellisima Roma! Arrivaderci Roma! Deanne & Catherine

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent service and central location-met our needs for a short break”
Reviews.Author: Jills18
Reviews.Content: This hotel was staffed by extremely friendly and helpful staff for whom nothing was too much trouble. They provided us with details of tours of Rome, booked tickets and made reservations without any effort. Very helpful to offer high quality transfers to and from airport - we only used the return transfer after virtually the same on an uncomfortable bus journey and expensive taxi- would advise use of the hotal transfer service. We stayed 2 nights in the family suite, this was great for 4 of us including an 11 year old and a 16 yr old as the layout gave us 3 semi-separated sleeping areas ( separate bedroom and 2 semi-separate lounge areas with sofa beds). Location was great just minutes walk from the Spanish steps on pedestrianised streets with lots of street cafes to choose from and close to the shopping centre. Would definitely recommend if you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel which is clean and accommodating, while you explore the sights of Rome. Only downside was room didn't offer any views to speak of but then we weren't intending to spend anytime in the room -just to use as a base. Would definitely return to this hotel if visiting Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good staff, good room and a good little resturant on the corner. We'd go back.”
Reviews.Author: smithey78
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the main hotel, and the room was good, a bit tight round the bed but off set by a good bathroom and access to a balcony. check in was easy and the reception staff were very pleasant, spoke good english which helped as our italian is limited. all staff were very pleasant and quick to any request. The reception staff do spend a good bit of time on the phone which could delay any answers or help needed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: papis_83
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5-night stay in rome at the mentioned hotel....we're very happy to say that it was a comfortable and pleasant stay...this hotel is beautifully located in the very heart of rome...this makes it extremely practical as everything is within walking distance...the rooms, though quite small, are comfortable. The english-speaking staff is very friendly...(special thanks go to Paola...who was always very eager to help us)...it would be our choice again if we decide to visit rome once again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all-round hotel with exceptional friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MissyMove
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at Hotel Condotti and I had to write in to say what a positive and pleasant experience it was. The location was perfect - we stayed in the Annexe building round the corner from the hotel which was more like a room in an apartment block just metres from the Spanish Steps, a stone's throw from the major attractions: Trevi Fountain, Capitolone, Colosseum, Roman Forum, Borghese Park.; plus Via del Condotti (the equivalent of our New Bond Street with all the designer shops) and Via del Corso (more high st brands). We had a good sized room with clean shower facilities, towels and sheets changed daily plus safety deposit box, fridge, small tv, a/c, wi-fi. We didn't feel neglected being away from the main hotel and the staff at reception were always helpful and eager to assist. Breakfast was also simple but nice. The hotel stay contributed to an romantic and memorable trip away with the bf and I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for affordable, clean and personable service.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: blade88
Reviews.Content: the service was a1 at all times , friendly and helpfull staff,, the room was clean tidy and air conditioned which is a must in august, located beside the spanish steps and a stones throw for the trevi fountain ,cloussum, and many more of roams major attractions this hotel is ideal, the best is as above , and as for the least i hpr to return 1 day to try and find it ,,,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, pity about renovations being done in peak season!”
Reviews.Author: Rovera21
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days here, so got to know the hotel quite well. I prefer to be factual Hotel Condotti is located just around the corner from the Piazza di Spagna (Spanish Steps) which is an excellent, central location to explore Rome. The hotel is situated in a reasonably quiet street with cafes and restaurants next door and up the street. The hotel doesn't have a restarant but does have a room in the basement where continental breakfast is served. Our room was rather small (normal and not a problem) but had a big bathroom and looks as though it was recently renovated. Our room overlooked the back of the hotel into other hotels and apartments airconditioning equipment and yards. The negatives were:- The hotel's management decision to paint and redecorate the stairwells during peak season made it a bit difficult to walk up or down the stairs around paint cans and tradesmen. Not normally a big issue but it was here because the small 3 person elevator didn't work for a day and we normally would use the stairs as we were only on the 2nd floor. We had no hot water for a day. I believe the communication to guests could have been better, regarding the renovations and the hot water issue. Staff were very good except for one rather "pompous" desk clerk. Thanks also go to the gentleman (whose name I've forgotten..sorry!) who ran the breakfast room, for making our cappucino and espresso without us asking...delicious! I would have rated higher if the renovations weren't being done during our time there. However I can recommend this hotel for great position and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location”
Reviews.Author: ProseccoFan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a beautiful side street packed with wonderful cafes , just a short walk to shopping, excellent gelato, & major attractions. The employees at the front desk were very friendly & helpful, even nice enough to let us practice our bad Italian with them. Our room was small, but very clean, quiet, & cool. The AC did a great job in the August heat. On the downside, the bed & comforter were not particularly soft and the free breakfast let us down (cappuccino from a cafeteria-like machine) compared to the quality you can get for a few Euros at most coffee bars. Overall I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast...perfect for couples”
Reviews.Author: jblbsl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value for our time in Rome. We spent a little over $500 for 4 nights there. It's literally a block from the Spagna stop on the B line, about 5 minutes from the Spanish Steps. The rooms are super small, so if you plan on spending a lot of time in the room, don't expect to have a lot of personal space. Although there was a little balcony off the side of the bathroom that looks into someone's backyard. That being said it was comfortable and all the employees were very helpful. There's a computer to check your email for free at the front desk and the breakfast was delicious. You can order espresso or cappuccino or just drink the coffee they provide. There was mortadella, salami and cheese every day plus juice and different kinds of pastries each day. One word of advice if you go anywhere in Italy- bring a watch or a small alarm clock because there are no clocks anywhere, including in the hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “we were very happy with our decision to stay at Condotti”
Reviews.Author: geo066
Reviews.Content: We booked a quadruple room for 3 days. Everything was very good during our stay at Condotti starting with the pleasant atitude of the personnel, the comfort of the room and the cleanliness. Definitely was above expectations. Beside, the location is ideal, with only few minutes walking distance from Piazza de Spagna and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller1964
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay. Hotel Condotti is in a great location. The rooms are small but very clean and comfortable. The staff is very professional and helpful. We loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Escape as fast as you can”
Reviews.Author: PAG89
Reviews.Content: Arrived and horrified, the elevator broken the room smelled, bathroom moldy and the towels so thin it was not worth using them...great location but escape as fast as you can

Reviews.Title: “Great holel in beautiful rome”
Reviews.Author: ndrewmg
Reviews.Content: Nice friendly staff hotel in a great location and close to pretty much everything. The room was nice and comfortable also. I will stay here again when i return in august.

Reviews.Title: “great location, helpful concierge, highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: brooke27Toronto
Reviews.Content: perfect location for shopping!!! Very close to attactions like spanish steps, colliseum. The room was great. Fairly good size, comfy beds, AC, elevator in the main building, although if you stay across the street, there is one flight you have to go up with no elevator (the concierge can carry your bags) , the breakfast was perfect too, although it ends at 9:45am. There was construction going on when we were there in the main building but it should be done in a week or so. They provide shampoo and conditioner. The walls are thin so you can hear your neighbours but just hope for good neighbours. We will be recommending this to friends and would return there ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “This makes it our third stay and we hope to be back for a fourth someday!”
Reviews.Author: pindawal
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location, just off the Spanish Steps and the fancy shopping street, Via Condotti. We have recommended the hotel to family and friends and in fact friends that were traveling with us had to stay elsewhere as the hotel was full. We have never stayed in the Annex. Elevator is being redone so be prepared to climb. Breakfast is typical European as described in earlier reviews. Bathrooms seem to have been updated since our last visit. Rooms are small but comfortable. Service is hit or miss and this time we had a hit with much help on restaurant recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, clean and functional. Ticks all the boxes for a city break.”
Reviews.Author: sjk129
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel mainly due to the location and were not disappointed. It is very close to Piazza Spagna, very convenient for restaurants, bars, shops and also the Trevi Fountain. The rooms are clean, there's plenty of surface space to put your belongings, large bathroom and ample wardrobe space. The walking area around the bed was not too generous, but it's certainly all that's required for a city break. I say this as there have been some comments about rooms being too small. We found that there is room for what you need. The breakfast was quite basic for the price, with the usual selection of yogurts, pastries, cooked meats, cheese, cereal, juice and hot drinks (made as ordered). The staff were friendly and helpful enough. Some public areas maybe required updating, but it did look like they were part way through an updating programme, with some new wallpaper on the staircase (A new lift was being fitted whilst we were there too). The hotel is on a side street, so there is less traffic than just a few yards up the road, which is also a bonus considering you are based in this very busy citty.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, small but comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jkpea
Reviews.Content: We had a great time using this boutique hotel as a base. It's surrounded by some lovely, if pricey, restaurants and bars and is in the perfect spot to explore Rome. The room was very small but the bed was really comfy and the bathroom was spotless. The staff were lovely - we even got a bottle of wine because the lift needed servicing. Make sure you're not in the annex when you book - we read several iffy reviews from people who were - but we were really happy with the whole experience and would stay there again. Beware of the area - although it's brilliant it's the Bond Street of Rome and pretty expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Very Mixed Results at Condotti”
Reviews.Author: TexasTripper34
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Condotti at both the front and back end of a cruise that departed from Rome. We had 2 competely different experiences. Upon arrival at the hotel the first time we were greeted by the staff, who spoke English, and our room was not yet ready. We expected this because it was early and the hotel agreed to hold our bags. They gave us luggage tags and locked them in a closet, while we went out for a bite to eat. When we returned, the bags had already been taken to our rooms which were now ready. Our rooms were in one of the annexes (the hotel consists of at least 3 different building within 1 block of the main hotel) which appears to have been recently remodeled. It was standard Euro size (small) but nice and clean, with a window that opened onto a nice street. WIFI access is available upon request at the front desk and was generally reliable. This was our good experience. Following the cruise we checked back into the hotel for one more night prior to our departure back home the following day. We were again welcomed by the front desk in English and again our rooms were not ready. They again agreed to hold our bags while we went out for a bite to eat. However, this time upon our return our bags were still sitting in the lobby untouched 3 HOURS LATER. To no one's surprise one of our small bags was missing and the security camera confirmed that someone had walked in and walked right out with it. The hotel confirmed they had agreed to hold our bags, but took no responsibility at all. We were later shown to our room, in a different annex. This room was old, tired, unclean.....how many other words can I use? It must have been the absolute worst room in the hotel, that was only used when they were completely booked. I can't imagine anyone would pay these prices and expect a room that looked like the one we got. I guess what you are paying for at this hotel is the location, but there are alot of hotels in Rome that have a good location, and this one doesn't offer much else. I would not stay here again nor would I recommend it to anyone. Stay here at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the small room scam!”
Reviews.Author: marymccarthydangelis
Reviews.Content: There were 10 of us in a group - we all had "issues" with our rooms when we arrived. We also saw other people have the same. You would check in and get sent to a room so small you could not get your luggage in the room. When you complain, only when you complain do they upgrade you - but only if you complain. It is not handicapped friendly at all. You must walk up stairs just to get to the elevator. It is clean and when we were moved to their annex - The Palcace it was fine except we got stuck in the tiny elevator. It is a great location.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: culturevultures2
Reviews.Content: We are 2 females who have just had a great 4 nights stay in the Condotti Palace. The location is superb and on arrival our cases were taken for us from the Condotti, round the corner to the C Palace and into our room. I had requested a twin, and there were 2 very decent sized beds in a lovely room. We had air con, hair drier, flat screen TV, mini bar, shower etc. Just the thing after a day's sightseeing in glorious weather. The reception staff were polite and helpful at all times. We did not take breakfast at the hotel, preferring to sit in one of the numerous local cafes and watch the world go by whilst having a latte and croissant. The location is really good. We had been concerned about safety as 2 women travelling, but we had no concerns during our stay. Will definitely return when next visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location with great staff”
Reviews.Author: SKAY18
Reviews.Content: Fluently bilingual staff certainly assisted us in our short stay in Rome. They recommended restaurants and tours. Hotel is near Spanish Steps, and excellent shopping. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The room is small but has all Tre...”
Reviews.Author: Linsing
Reviews.Content: The room is small but has all Tre necessary accoutrements to make it comfy. The bed is very good. Wi-fi is included. The breakfast room was being remodeled when we were there in April 2010 and was closed. The bathroom is comfortable although the shower is small. The walls are thin between rooms yet we never heard outside noise, even with the window open. The front desk clerks were very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: ossama
Reviews.Content: we stayed for four magnificent nights in Condotti , it was a perfect choice for our 1st visit to rome thxs to TA. It is perfectly located,many attractions & restaurants are within walking distances .despite the hotel's restaurant was under refurbishment , yet we enjoyed our breakfast offered by the hotel in a near by " cafe blanco" just round the corner in via del corce . Hotel staff were so helpful specially Romero.room was adequate and tidy

Reviews.Title: “The perfect loacation in Rome city”
Reviews.Author: OsloAlexOslo
Reviews.Content: Best location You could ask for. A few steps from The Spanish steps and right outside al the best shops and resturants. Everything You should see when i Rome within 5 to 15minutes walk. Friendly staff Paula, Romolo and the sining lady sevring You the breakfast !

Reviews.Title: “great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: hentraveler
Reviews.Content: We loved the location. close to metro and beautiful street. front desk staff was very helpful. we had a great little terrace with a table and chairs. room was very small, but updated and chic.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Condotti was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: mandywalter63
Reviews.Content: The most important feature of a hotel room for my husband and I is it needs to be quiet, clean, a comfortable bed and our own bathroom. I was looking for a hotel that would fit these needs. It didn't need to be fancy (we do that when we travel for my husand on business trips) because I knew that we wouldn't be in the room that much. We stayed 3 nights. Our room was in another building, just around the corner from the hotel (about 30 meters). We walked to the hotel every morning for a wonderful beakfast that was included (it took us less than a minute to walk around the corner). The window to our room faced a courtyard. We were able to leave the windows open at night. Very quiet and very safe! Hotel staff was wonderful. Will definitely go back and stay. My only complaint was the pillows! They are rock hard and stiff....but as we continued our journey through Italy....every hotel's pillows were just like that! So if your picky about your pillow....bring your own. Great location to.

Reviews.Title: “Good customer service, personnel,rennovated,good location,clean”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyBetinha
Reviews.Content: Very good location, good personnel, and customer service, cozy, clean, rennovated, a place to stay. I will stay there in another time. Just put the computer in another area of the hotel with a chair for the guest to sit.It was in the middle of the lobby and no chairs. Besides this everything was great. Beti

Reviews.Title: “Be very careful in booking”
Reviews.Author: lpslps
Reviews.Content: Be very careful in booking the hotel. The Hotel Condotti operates this hotel, an annex "Antico", and a B&B Dependance. There is also a hotel Condotti Palace. I attempted to book the Hotel Condotti thru Expedia. I telephoned to confirm that I was booking the hotel, not the Antico annex. Expedia called the hotel to confirm. When I received the the confirmation it still said the hotel was requested but not guaranteed. Expedia said specific confirmation of the hotel was not possible. I finally booked directly on the hotel web site. I will stay there next October and will report on the reality then,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: cumi
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 6 night stay at Hotel Condotti. Excellent location! We arrived very late at night but were greeted very warmly by Mr. Vladimir at the reception desk and Alex who helped us with our bags. Room was small but cosy. Bed really comfortable. Fresh towels everyday. Adequate breakfast and yummy cuppacino every morning! Yes, we could smell the baking every night when we returned from a day of sightseeing. Lots of restaurants and pizzarias nearby for our meals. Spanish Steps just a minute away. Although it was a busy side street, it was not noisy and I had a good night's sleep on all 6 nights!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkBaldy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just completed a trip to Italy with four nights in Rome and five nights in Florence. While in Rome we stayed at the Hotel Condotti which was recommended by a friend. This is a terrific small hotel on a quaint cobblestone street. The location could not be better...you are about two blocks from the Spanish Steps. The lobby is small and beautiful There is a free internet point to use and a very nice breakfast included every morning. The staff is very nice and helpful as well. I found the rates quite reasonable (about 120 euro per night). I requested their superior double room which has your own private terrace, This is a real treat and, if booking, you should ask for this room. The room was quite nice and clean. If we return to Rome, which is our fervent hope, we would definitely stay at the Hotel Condotti again.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted with our choice”
Reviews.Author: EnglandPam
Reviews.Content: As two 'mature' female travellers the location of the Condotti is excellent, we could walk to most attractions and felt really safe after eating locally in a good selection of reasonable restaurants each evening. The twin bedded room was small but completely adequate for our stay, comfortable bed, clean and a quiet night's sleep.The reception staff were particularly helpful eg. happy to book us a slot at the Galleria Borghese etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: FAN-and-MOO
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in an out of the way location last year we were looking for a more central place to stay and we weren't disappointed! The hotel is really close to the Spagna metro station and just off the busy Via Condotti. Although we arrived at night it was really easy to find and we felt safe walking around the area. The staff who greeted us were polite and friendly and spoke excellent English. Our room was a twin at the back of the hotel and although so close to the main shopping streets was really quiet. The room was small but clean and comfortable. There was a mini bar and safe and a wall mounted TV. The beds were comfortable but I found the pillows a little hard although there were additional ones in the wardrobe. The breakfast room was in the basement and the staffed by a lovely Italian lady. She made us coffee as we helped ourselves to the buffet, both of which were excellent. There was meat and cheese, muesli and cornflakes, yoghurts, rolls, pain au chocolat, croissants, various spreads, fruit salad and freshly baked cakes, which we smelt baking the night we arrived! The location was great both for sightseeing and amenities; there were plenty of bars really close to the hotel and some great restaurants. We could walk everywhere and come and go as we pleased. On our last day as our flight wasn't until the evening after checking out we were able to leave our bags behind the front desk and go out for the day then collect them where we were ready to catch our flight. We had a really good stay in this hotel, loved the location and price and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “stayed in annexe,twin room size adequate, bathroom excellent, breakfast outside door in morning”
Reviews.Author: sadbhIreland
Reviews.Content: mother and daughter stayed. room size just adequate, pleased with bathroom,daily change of towels, breakfast served on shelf outside door each morning-no fresh fruit, otherwise typical italian continental breakfast, very convenient. Some noise at night. Good location

Reviews.Title: “beware of bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: lizzysher
Reviews.Content: This hotel has two sites. One is the Palace and one is the Hotel. Although located near each other, they are vastly different. The hotel is nice, the Palace is not. The first red flag was when I recieved a stingy confirmation from the Hotel for my booking in February that stated that since I received a good price for my stay, that it would not include breakfast. I was paying around 85 Euro for off season. So, I promtly cancelled my reservation sensing that I already didn't like the way they greedily conducted business. It's not like European breakfasts are austere and usually consist of a croissant and coffee so I couldn't figure out what the big deal was. However, I booked the hotel again a few days later to see if I would get the same response since it clearly stated on the website from which I booked that breakfast was included at this rate (venere.com). I know the breakfast thing sounds kind of trivial, but it can be expensive to eat out in Rome and having the convenience of eating and getting out early is nice when on vacation. I did not get the no breakfast response so I kept the reservation. I arrived late in the evening around 10:30. They informed me I was not staying at the Hotel but rather their annex which is called Condotti Palace (not Condotti Hotel) instead of the Hotel. I was very tired and wanted to get to my room asap We left the hotel and walked outside around the corner to the Palace annex, The person who helped us with our bags then commenced a 5 minute conversation with a restaurant owner in the street on our way to their "annex", which is really another B&B called Condotti Palace. This may not sound like a big deal, but we were clearly very tired and had all our luggage and had to just stand there in the street while he chatted. away to his friend. I had tointerrupt and ask the luggage man to please get us to our room, it was almost 11:00 p.m. by this time. The room has gross blue carpet and was very dark. The breakfast was not served in the room that you see on the website but rather in a narrow hallway leading to the room. We didn't eat breakfast there. There was a bunch of cracker like snacks on the dresser in the room but no signs as to whether they were complimentary or to purchase. No price list. We didn't touch them, but when we checked out they inquired if we ate anything from the cracker stas. The only nice thing I have to say about the hotel is that it is close to the subway which is not necessary since Rome's sites are all within walking distance. I have read of others who had this bait and switch happen to them too and were sorely disappointed by their scheme. I stayed at the Santiquttro B&B near the Colloseum and had a much better experience. I guess if I had stayed at the actual Condotti hotel, it may have been a nicer experience, but I can't trust them now. It was also obvious the front desk buy doens't really like Americans too. Again, I have seen on other websites where people were fooled into staying at the hotel but moved to the "annex" Palace.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: jessybobs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Condotti for 3 nights in December, it was a lovley little hotel, very near the Spanish Steps. Our twin room was lovely and spacious and even had an extra sofa that pulled out into a bed. It was decorated beautifully, though was showing a little wear and tear, but spotlessly clean, the bathroom also. Our room looked onto the quaint Roman street of Mario di Fiori, lined with restaurants and shops. Staff were very helpful and friendly and though we arrived early our room was ready for us in 5 minutes. The hotel is a great base for exploring Rome, it is on a small street and fairly quiet apart from a little traffic. Breakfast was OK, filling but not a great deal of choice, but for the price no complaints. The breakfast room was very small and though we never had a problem, many had to wait a while for a table, waiters were very pleasant (we didn't meet the singing waitress which was a shame) Overall Mum and I had a lovely stay at the Hotel Condotti and will certainly stay there again and I highly recommend it, I booked direct with the hotel which offered the best price from other booking websites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Graham1366
Reviews.Content: I dont write too many reviews but I just wanted to express my thanks to the staff and the hotel for making my short stay a very memorable one. The Hotel is very clean, quiet and the location is amazing, I only had to walk a few steps to see some of the fantastic sights that Rome has to offer. The staff were great, very helpfull and it helps that since I dont really speak any Italian that they spoke English. They told me were to go for some amazing food and also some of the sights to see that I may have missed. It was very relaxing, the bed was really comfy and I will go back if I am lucky enough to get a chance to visit. Thaks again for a great stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality of staffs”
Reviews.Author: ICHI69
Reviews.Content: I have traveled many times in the US and Europe. This time I visited Rome for the first time. When I choose a hotel, I usually think the location is the most predominant thing. This time I stayed at this hotel with my wife for 4 nights in November, and the location was perfect as I expectsd. We could especially enjoy Borghese Park where we could go through Spanish Steps in ten minutes and could enjoy colored leaves, Roman pine trees and of course musiums. We could also go to Trevi fountain and Popolo place on foot and to the Metro station by 3 minutes walk, which could lead us to Vatican, Colosseo and Foro Romano. We were pleased to spend at the hotel with very kind and warm-hearted staffs. When we stay at a hotel, the most important thing for us is the quality of staffs. The staffs in this hotel was very good. We could feel them having been our old friends. The restaurant which the staff introduced was good, which was just around the corner, named "Hostaria al 31".

Reviews.Title: “Book this hotel for the location - but know that it is a 2 star”
Reviews.Author: dalcy3
Reviews.Content: From reading the reviews, I think that there must be a difference in the rooms if you are in the "annex" which is down the street and around the corner or the "hotel" -- I booked on Hotels.com and got the cheapest rate available and I think that is how I ended up in the "annex". The location is INCREDIBLE and I was fine on my own - however, you should be prepared to be happy with 2 star accommodation. The carpet in my room was deeply soiled, the walls are dirty - the TV remote was covered in grime, I didn't dare to use the teapot because it was also covered in grime. I will say that the bathroom looks new. This place would be completely different with fresh carpeting, wallpaper and some new amenities. Free WiFi here is a real bonus!

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: hobokentraveler123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I somewhat frequent travelers and do a lot of research before choosing hotels. Unfortunately, our research was wrong for the Hotel Condotti. The location is good, right near the Spanish Steps, and the staff is reasonably nice and speaks English. However, I specifically booked the main Hotel and not the apartments because of the different reviews and locations. Apparently that did not matter because when we checked in we were sent to their apartments (Antico 55 I believe), which is literally a few rooms in an apartment building way too close to the Spanish Steps and right above a very loud cafe (which was more like a bar than an Italian cafe). To make matters worse, they had turned the heat on and would not turn it off so when it was over 70 degrees outside the heat made the room unbearably hot. Overall, it was not horrible but there are much better places to stay in Rome for the money.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: loukiav
Reviews.Content: Clean, cosy, in the heart of Rome. We all were glad with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here in August if Air Conditioning is important to you”
Reviews.Author: mulletville
Reviews.Content: My wife and I started our dream vacation in Rome. Unfortunately, we chose the Hotel Condotti. We specifically requested a top floor room with a balcony because it was recommended. It was, as expected for Rome in August, unbearably hot. The problem, of course, is that, while that is expected for the city, we reasonably expected that the temperature in our room would be comfortable. As American's we recognized that our standards for air conditioned bliss were likely a bit more strenuous than the Italians, but the AC simply didn't work at all. We requested a room change and were accommodated, but it came with an attitude. The room we received was similarly hot, but rather than ask for another room we toughed it out. It was one miserably hot night. The next day, the clerk tried to charge us for the much larger and nicer original room. Now on the good side, if you were to choose this hotel during a cooler time you might like it much better as the street-side room with the balcony was nicely outfitted and the location can't be beat near the Spanish Steps. Still, I have to think you can do better in August than a hotel with - seemingly - no working AC units.

Reviews.Title: “HIdden Jem”
Reviews.Author: EmmaVin
Reviews.Content: I travel to Italy every year and sometimes twice per year. For the last 15 years I have to Rome and always stayed in this hotel, although many other options are available. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. The location is superior . It is located at the Spanish Steps, in the center os the best shoping are of Rome. There are many great restaurants just around the corner and the best one is next door to the hotel i.e. Restaurante 34. Many tourist attraction are within 20 min walking. NIce breakfast is served daily by a very friendly staff. The rooms are not large, but very clean and comfortable. You would enjoy it. Emmavin, Los Angeles, CA

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location to see all sights in Rome - very friendly and helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: Sue28
Reviews.Content: I arranged to take my mum for her 70th Birthday (who walks with a walking stick) and daughter aged 23, to Rome last week as a special birthday week away. Not travelling alone before I was a bit usure as what to expect and have written this review to help others in the same situation. We stayed at the Condotti from 23rd - 27th June 09 and had a great time . I arranged the hotel private pick up (70 Euros)from Ciampino Airport (3 people) which could not have been smoother the gentleman greated us on arrival and was friendly and attentive to my mum. from the time that we arrived at the hotel the staff very excellent helping us arranging trips and booking taxi's etc. We had booked a tripple bedded room which was really nicely decorated but a little cramped, I mentioned this to the desk staff the following morning and they arranged for us to move into the Condotti Palace ( just a round the corner) for an extra 25 euros per night, this was spacious and perfect for all of us. The location is excellent with lots of restaurants and shops near by with a taxi rank at the top of the road. although the hotel does not have it's own restaurant there are lots of local restaurants within walking distance.The restaurant next to the main reception Al 24 is fantastic, all the locals eat there and the food is excellent especially the Lobster (well worth 25 euros) We visited the Colleseum, The Vatican , Sistine Chapel and the Basicilla, the tour bus is good value too, especially if you cannot walk too far. We will definatly be returning to the hotel but will request to stay at the palace. Make sure you take flat shoes as there are lots of cobbled streets!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: GaryCentralFL
Reviews.Content: I was especially impressed by the friendliness and helpfullness of the staff, first on the phone when we were calling from the US, and then in person when we arrived. The location is also about the best I could imagine. They are on a small side street just off of the Via Condotti, and a block from the Spanish Steps. That one block distance is wonderful, since you can walk out and be right in the heart of everything without the noise. The rooms and breakfast were both good. There are cafe's everywhere around. If you are flying in, let them schedule yur airport pickup for you. We used their service to/from the airport, but had scheduled our own (more expensive) service for other trips. The service they used not only saved us money, but were far friendlier and pulled right up to the door. Our other service parked two blocks away and were surly. Don't even think about renting a car to drive into the historic section of Rome. When we travel to Rome again, I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, not as on pictures”
Reviews.Author: ANicolai
Reviews.Content: I had 3 nights of stay at the Condotti. You cant beat the location with Spanish Steps just around the corner with hotel located in a charming street next to Via Condotti. But the hotel is only a 3 star if you get their best rooms. I was awarded the infamous attick room (read reviews about this from someone else) and it is next to the elevtor machine room, which makes unbearable noises whenever the elevator operates. My room was very cold, so i had to use the heater fan which also adds to the noise. The bed have only blankets with sheets rapped around them. I hate that, and whilst being comfortable in summertime, it is not nice knowing that hundreds of people have used the same ones. Having leaning ceilings, and being a man, you cannot stand while showering. The free wireless hotspot does not reach this room. I had a look at a friends room on the third floor, and that looked much better. But everything is worn, fromt he early 90'ies i would expect. When i asked to swap rooms, i was offered one in the annex without windows, so i forgot about that and i plugged in my earplugs and put the pillow over my head to ride it out. Reception staff was always nice and freiendly, and thre is a wine bar/restaurant a few meeters down the street from the hotel with the most amazing wines by the glass and good food too.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jingo14
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in July. Staff were very nice, and lobby was small but very neat. Room was average size, which is quite typical of Rome. Very comfortable, and location was outstanding. Breakfast was adequate, and everything was fresh. If you only have a short time and want to be near the Spanish steps this is perfect. Lovely wine bar next door with a large range of places to eat to suit every budget. Do not forget via Condotti, when July is sale time! Bargains to be had. Overall we would come back without hesitation, as we loved the location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Condotti!”
Reviews.Author: c0vergirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days in December in Hotel Condotti and loved it from the very first minute. Its excellent location, fantastic service and cosy rooms make it an ideal place for a weekend getaway. Think is a very good value for money, considering that it is a small, boutique style hotel (which we like) and a very good location. Francesca was always very helpful. Thank you for a fantastic weekend in Rome, will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location!!”
Reviews.Author: emm4
Reviews.Content: Four of us went to Rome, me, my husband, and best friends on November 22nd 07 for 3 nights. We stayed at the Hotel Condotti. This is a lovely hotel, small but really cosy and in a great location close to the famous shops and spanish steps. The rooms are lovely furnished with a good size bathroom, dressing table, tv and mini bar. The towels were changed everyday for us, which is always a bonus. The only bad point about our room was that we were at the front of the hotel on the first floor and it got a little noisy first thing in the morning, deliveries to the shops and near by restaurant, otherwise the hotel is great. The front desk staff are really pleasant and always there to help with a smile on their face. The breakfast is not up to much, small room downstairs. We found that it was better to go out and find a nice coffee shop etc for breakfast and watch Rome wake up!! All in all I would certainly go back to Rome and Hotel Condotti, it was a very enjoyable weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SLDSanFrancisco_CA
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, and I second the opinions from the reviewer on 12/26. You can't beat the location, and the hotel staff are EXCELLENT. Breakfast is nothing spectacular, but it's included in the rate and sufficient. Yes, the rooms are small - but you're staying near the Spanish Steps for a very good rate. I stayed at this hotel 7 years ago as well, and continue to be impressed with the service and value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: SinFronteras54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Condotti for 4 days at the beginning of our 2 week trip to Italy and then again 3 days at the end. We weren't sure where we were staying at the end of our trip, but we had such a good experience at the beginning of our trip that we decided to come back. Though some reviewers were unhappy with the fact that the rooms were around the corner from reception and that they had to walk a few feet to a coffee bar for breakfast we found this of no inconvenience at all. If you travel at all in Europe you understand that rooms are far smaller than in the U.S. We found the rooms clean and comfortable. We actually stayed both in the hotel proper and the rooms around the corner. While those around the corner are newer, the ones in the hotel proper are more charming. They're older and less ample than the newer ones. If you stay in the hotel itself, breakfast is served in the basement. If you're looking for that kind of convenience, you should ask if you can stay at the hotel itself. Otherwise, breakfast is pretty similar in both places (you serve yourself at the hotel; are served at the coffee bar). The lady making the coffees in the basement is a lovely soul with a beautiful voice which she uses to sing some beautiful notes. We recommend this place for people who know what to expect when traveling abroad. It is a nice little oasis. We found the folks to be very helpful and kind. There was a young woman who was particularly helpful and with a wonderful New York accent when speaking English.

Reviews.Title: “Condotti = great location for cheap price”
Reviews.Author: JWPM
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Condotti recently while in Rome. While not luxurious by any stretch of the imagination, it was perfectly suitable to us for our first time in Rome - inexpensive (compared to most places in Rome) and clean. However, the best part about the Hotel Condotti is its location - right next to the Spanish Steps (25 metres at most), in the heart of the exclusive shopping area of Rome. For this, it was perfect. The staff were perfectly accomodating, even when, on the last morning, we had no water (not just no hot water, but no water at all). We were given a room in one of their other properties (around the corner - 2 min walk) and a 30% discount on the overnight rate. 2 things to note. If you are coming from the airport, it is 10 - 20 euro's cheaper to take a taxi, rather than booking their limousine service. Also, the rooms in their "other properties" are nicer - try to get an upgrade from the main hotel building. Overall, a good place to stay. Would we stay there again in Rome? - yes, if we were after something cheap....no, if we were after something a little more romantic and special.

Reviews.Title: “can be over priced, items stolen”
Reviews.Author: BrindiCruiser
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice but not luxurious, so the rack rate seemed pretty expensive to me. The last minute rates are better value for money. Some of the staff were helpful and others were not. However, what really pissed me off was that my wedding ring was stolen from my room. I don't really know who was responsible, but at least some of the staff did not seem to fussed by this. Of course, I should not have left it in the room, but I was very disappointed to have it stolen.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special but well positioned”
Reviews.Author: pgreco
Reviews.Content: Magically placed just a few steps away from the romantic piazza di Spagna. In the heart of Rome cant be more central. Apart from that ,not the best place to stay. Let me explain better: there is nothing really wrong with the hotel as the room was clean the personnel was kind and the bed comfortable; but personally i believe its overpriced and for the money it costs i was expecting it to be more luxurious rather than just basic. I suppose Rome is one of the most touristic cities in the world and that boosts up the prices. Only had breakfast in the hotel and found it pleasing but still not satisfactory. Rome is so beautiful and there are so many things to see and do that you are probably going to spend only the sleeping hours in the hotel . In that case Hotel Condotti is a CLEAN and tranquil-although extremely central little hotel to have a night rest.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: paulharrisaia
Reviews.Content: In Rome we stayed at the Condotti Hotel just 100 M from the Spanish Steps. The main lobby in a converted palace has rooms upstairs. Its like a small "boutique" hotel but there are also buildings nearby that add more rooms. There is no dining room, but for breakfast, you go to a local bakery and show your key and everything is free. I liked that better than eating in a hotel dining room anyway. Sitting out on a cobblestone drive sipping expresso while Rome wakes up was truly an experience. Be careful though, not all of the rooms have been upgraded. Ask for the rooms on Via Della Croce next to Fioria Fiora restaurant. They are in a modern Italian style decorations. Dark tile floors, marble walled bathroom, latest fixtures, flatscreen TV. Very comfortable room. We stayed on the 4th floor and there was a small patio with 6 tables. No one knew it was there and every evening we would enjoy a bottle of wine while the dusk evolved. No panoramic views but seeing the colors of the other building change was nice. The room was clean nicely furnished and very comfortable. The staff was helpful, especially Alex. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Hotel Condotti!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kedmunds12
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about how much I loved staying at this Hotel! I was travelling alone and very nervous, but the entire staff was so very friendly and nice I felt as if I were staying with family. I would reccomend this hotel to everyone. The location is wonderful, literally a minutes walk to The Spanish Steps. There is a taxi stand close by for those trips outside the city wall and all other attractions are withn an easy walking distance. the rooms are small, but very nice. If your lucky ( like I was) you can get a charming room with its very own terrace. I plan on returning next year and will be staying at the Condotti again. Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Barbara-BNewport
Reviews.Content: I first discovered this little gem of a hotel in 1997 while traveling on business for my company. Being new to Rome at that time, I needed a great central location, restaurants within walking distance, shops and most important a familiar landmark, (ie: The Spanish Steps). Since 1997, I have returned at least twice a year and have developed a friendship with the manager and the front desk staff. They have consistently referred me to excellent restaurants, have sent a car to the airport to pick me up and made dinner reservations for me as a 5 star hotel would. What makes this hotel a gem is not the tiny rooms, but the staff and the location. I work for a luxury villa rental company and 6 years ago we added the Condotti to our list of hotels for our clients as an overnighter. We also offer a few 5 star hotels in Rome as well. The rooms at the Condotti are tiny, but well equipped and have been refurbished over the years and now for those clients that want to go a little more upscale, they have just opened the Condotti Palace, just around the corner. For the Savvy Traveler, who does not want to spend a fortune or must stay at the Hassler, this 3 star hotel delivers 5 star service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Prospector1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Condotti Hotel for four nights in mid-Sept. Friendly welcome and service throughout our stay. Excellent location about 150 metres from Spanish Steps (and Metro), and sited on a small, quiet backstreet. Bedrooms are small but that's what we were expecting in an old building but kept very clean and comfortable bed. But there ain't much room around the bed! Bathroom well equiped but small too. Breakfast was fine with excellent coffee, croisants, fruit etc and some cereal. Very nice senora looks after you and even provided breakfast on our departure around 7.00am even though breakfast is not 'open' to 7.30am. We ate in adjacent restaurant on our last night (Ristorante 34) and had a superb meal - pasta dishes outstanding, as they are in most places! Reception staff also helpful and even booked some restaurants for us prior to our arrival. Be warned the lift is tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Condotti”
Reviews.Author: witness1
Reviews.Content: My son and I traveled to Rome and stayed 23-29 July at the Hotel Condotti, 37 Via Mario del Fiori, a short walk from the Metro stop right next to the Spanish Steps. We're very surprised at reading some of the recent reviews of the property in that we actually found it to be quite lovely, and the staff (especially Cezary) attentive and eager to lend assistance. The staff's command of the English language was just fine and considerably better than our feeble attempt at conversing in Italian, and every attempt was made by the staff to address any concerns or requests we made of them. After all, we were in THEIR country and frankly the world should not be required to be fluent in English just because we speak it at home -- we weren't at HOME! We definitely made every attempt not to come across as the "Ugly Americans" and perhaps our positive experience was a result of not trying to be heavy handed or insistent upon having all things as they are back home. Our room on the 3rd floor was lovely and the air conditioning was fine (in fact, sometimes it bordered on v-e-r-y cool but the guest can control the air conditioning). While it took some getting used to squeezing our American girths into the very small shower stall, we simply viewed it as one more difference between life in the U.S. and that in Italy to be embraced and enjoyed. After all, we traveled to Rome to experience something different, not life as we know it back home! The exterior and lobby areas of the hotel are absolutely charming (the hotel is located on a picturesque cobblestone side street right off the Via Condotti), and if you're in luck, Arthur and Nike (2 very well behaved miniature Schnauzers who I believe are pets of the owner) will greet you at the door. While an elevator is at your disposal when transporting your luggage to your room, you will need to walk up a short flight of stairs to reach it. A bellperson is available to assist in bringing your luggage to your room if needed. The breakfast bar is located in the basement of the hotel and serves a nice assortment of cheeses, salami, croissants, breads, cereals, fruit, yogurt, coffee and juice. A lovely little lady is in constant but discreet attendance and oftentimes will be softly singing, which added to the experience. While some may find the menu somewhat limited, again -- YOU'RE IN ROME and that is how the Romans do breakfast. And if you look carefully at the people you will see in Rome, the locals are quite discernable from the tourists in that the Romans are almost all svelte and in wonderful physical condition (light breakfasts and all that walking, I'm sure), while the tourists (ourselves included) looked positively gigantic -- a very HUMBLING experience, I can assure you, and one that inspires non-Romans to hit the gym at their earliest opportunity! Please do not let any recent negative reviews sour you or dissuade you from staying at the Hotel Condotti. Even by U.S. standards, we found the hotel to be quite nice and considering it's fantastic location (truly within walking distance to everything except the Vatican), a hotel to which we most definitely will return!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot recommend”
Reviews.Author: NNC0
Reviews.Content: Pro: Bathroom was first rate. Conveniently located near subway which was about 100 yards away. Neighbourhood is great for sightseeing. Right beside the Spanish Steps and on what would best be described as a pedestrian mall area which permitted a very safe and comfortable way to explore with very few roads to cross. Building and rooms were quite clean. Cons It was 40 deg in Rome and we could barely feel a puff from the Air conditioner (dehumidifier type) a foot away. The staff said that it was functioning properly. The bottom line is that the room did not get anywhere near to comfortable room temperatures and we sweated. The TV remote didn't work and they didn't ever fix it. Although we woke up beforehand, we did notice that our wake up calls were not made to our room. The reason we wanted them was that the clock radio did not seem to function either although maybe it was due to our own mistakes in programming it. Overall, guest services or assistance was of no use to guests Of note - the night staff did not speak English in any practical sense. They had a limited number of tables (approx 8) in breakfast room. Guests had to wait in the lobby one floor up and keep going downstairs to check for a free table. Breakfast offerings were minimal. Cereal, bread, fruit, yogurt capuccino and tea etc. Nothing hot was offered. Although rooms are supposed to be non smoking there were ashtrays right beside the non smoking sign on the table and the bell boy said to ignore the sign if I wanted to smoke. (I smoked outside). Because there were so few electrical outlets, you couldn't plug in the kettle or fridge without unplugging a table lamp. Dresser looked good but drawers were actually just shelves on wheels. It was very annoying as anything put in the top drawer kept falling through to lower drawers. Overall: The place could be a really nice hotel with the right staff but my overall feeling about the place was that guests were regarded as inconvenient nuisances and were being milked. There was virtually no attempt at providing good service. I was pleased to be leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Give this a Miss”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want a bad start to your vacation try this hotel. We reserved three rooms and they were all small, dirty and very tired. It was boiling hot in Rome and the airconditioning in one did not work. There was graffitti carved into the walls of the dirty elevator. The carpets were filthy and the paint was peeling off the walls in the one room. The staff were rude and asked what we expected from a three star hotel. Not sure why we had to pay cash to the front desk every time we called for a taxi. The only redeeming feature of this hotel is the location. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location but tiny”
Reviews.Author: lonestartravels
Reviews.Content: Great location near the Spanish Steps. We stayed for four nights in mid March in a triple which really is a double with a twin bed(not a rollaway) brought in. Our room was on the 3rd floor facing the street. It was a little loud at night with all of the Scottish Rugby fans in Rome. Since it was cold, the window was closed, but the glass is not double glazed. Although the room was tiny, it was very clean and had a nice size modern bathroom with ample storage for luggage. There is no room safe. Breakfast was included in the price of the room but could be crowded in the morning. The staff were friendly, and the reception staff were helpful. We paid 210 euros per night which is a bargain for Rome. Our room was across from the elevator which was not noisy but was very small. We only used it for our luggage. There was no bar to have a drink nor a spacious lobby to relax, but we were only in our room at night to sleep. There are lots of cafes, bars and restaurants nearby. If you are in Rome in the off season (not hot or crowded), and the Hotel Condotti has a reasonable price, then I would recommend this hotel. High season and hot weather- not so sure.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Reception”
Reviews.Author: RadarLondon_England
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not clean and smells of old, dirty carpets. The showers are cheap and badly fitted and leak all over the bathroom. The beds are too narrow. Breakfast is served on the cheapest of plastic plates. Two of the receptionists are o,k, but a third would do better as a prison guard. Seriously unwelcoming and slightly aggressive. The bedrooms on the road are much too noisy and need double glazing. The position is perfect and the price is low but there is no excuse for dirt and rudeness, It would not cost too much to do up this hotel and I cannot understand why it is such a grubby state.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shelley1495
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this hotel. Right in the middle of the ancient city. A quirky little hotel. Yes the place is in need of some refurb, but its clean, and somehow you can't but be charmed by its little idiosyncrasies. We loved it for the money, what it lacks in facitlities it makes up in charm. The staff were friendly, and the bathrooms although shared (some) were clean, and the showers warm. There's no doubt Rome is expensive, and sure we could probably get a better hotel in the location, but we would have to pay for it too!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Condotti is a very small hotel that offers a great location very close to the Spanish Steps and within walking distance to virtually everything you could want to see in Rome. Renaldo, who is quite often at the front desk in the afternoons and evening, is very friendly and very helpful with everything from making dinner reservations to offering suggestions on what to do and where to go. He also speaks 5 languages. Our room was a standard double room which was quite small and really didn't have much of a view but then again we weren't in the room long enough to let that bother us. The longer we stayed at this hotel the more we liked it.......we would definitely go back and probably the next time try to book a more superior room just for the pure enjoyment of it.

Reviews.Title: “This is my favourite hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is my favourite hotel in Rome because: 1 It has an excellent location just round the corner from the Pantheon on a cute little piazza - I can't think of anywhere better to be placed in Rome 2 It's very reasonably priced for its location 3 It's in a converted palace! The rooms have lovely high ceilings; the ones at the back overlook a quiet courtyard and the ones at the front overlook the square - very atmospheric either way! 4 The staff are lovely It IS only three stars, which I think some other reviewers haven't taken into account, but for the money, I'm not really sure what people expect! There are undoubtedly more luxurious hotels, but given my points above, I will definitely go back and would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Super Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The central location and the fact that it is in part of an old palace made it a good experience for my wife and I. It's really a pensione and not a hotel. It was part of our travel adventure to open the locked, massive 400 year old double doors to the building each evening and go up in the antique elevator. The place is located on an "out of the way street" that is still in the center of all the action. (It is about ten minutes to the forum and a five minute walk to the Pantheon.) The square it sits on is well policed, with guards posted at each end. We felt very safe in the entire neighbrohood. On the minus side, as others point out, it can be loud at night thanks to good old Roman vespa scooters, sirens, etc. (We happened to be there on Friday and Saturday evenings, so it was even more pronounced than Thursday when we checked in.) Our room was clean. The desk clerk gave us good recommendations for dinner and the staff was very helpful in calling taxis for us. If your idea of travel is a full service American hotel, this might not be for you. But if you understand that traveling outside your native country should not be an effort to replicate those experiences you have at home, you'll enjoy the quirky charm.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of price changes when you arrive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The place is very old and needs a lot of work. The rooms are clean but do not expect air conditioning as they state. The breakfast is terrrible . The manager on duty first wanted to charge me 260 Euro then he went to 240 220 until I finally got him to agree to 200. Also when they tell you that they can arrange transporation for you BEWARE, the inflated costs are considerable. Spend time and make your own arrangements prior. I would not stay there again for the price. Yes it is close to things but there are better places for the same amount very nearby

Reviews.Title: “It was bearable at best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I paid a not so bargain price for this hotel - and, it was not worth half of what we paid. We were supposed to stay in the newer annex according to our reservation. However, when we arrived, the staff put us in a tiny room that had a sewer-like smell and an outdated bathroom with a broken toilet. When we complained they told us essentially that it was too bad - it was too late to cancel our reservation since they have a three day in advance cancellation policy. When we mentioned that we would have to complain to the travel agent, and try to find a way out, the staff told us we could stay in the annex as reserved. The annex was better - it seemed cleaner, but it was still small and we had to climb a long flight of steps to get to our room (all of the rooms in the annex are at the top of the stairs). We chose this hotel because it is near the Spanish Steps and, it had some good reviews. The staff varies day to day, and the staff we dealt with after the first night was a lot nicer. I learned from walking around Rome that it is not a big city, and we would probably have been happier at a more comfortable hotel. In fact, I had stayed in a hotel on the Via Veneto a few years ago, and I did not have a complaint about that location (or the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: dkmr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in March 2003. Location is excellent - near the Spanish Steps and great shopping and dining. It's on a side street with little car traffic. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are quite small (typical of many European hotels) with barely enough room for anything but the bed and a bureau. Has a tiny elevator big enough only for one person with a bag. Nice breakfast in a basement breakfast room. We paid only about 180 Euros per night, breakfast included. There are probably many other hotels in Rome that are as good at this price. No reason not to stay here, but shopping around may provide a better deal elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean, with a friendly staff and great location - very close to the Pantheon.

HotelInfo.Name: Condotti Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Mario de' Fiori 37, 00187 Rome, Italy
